The super powered animal phenomenon seemed to have spread worldwide.

In the plains of Africa, dozens of terrified citizens and tourists ran screaming as the earth shook beneath them. The cause of the shaking was the aptly named Quaker, a huge bi-pedal elephant strode confidently after them with a huge smile on her face. She enjoyed the chase, but it was the anticipation of what was yet to come that was her real cause for excitement. She was taller than a house and loved to throw her weight around. Being an elephant, she had plenty of it to throw. She had a round belly and large breasts which she displayed proudly, but really enjoyed applying her full weight on anything smaller than her under her feet or her massive, round ass. At her size, anything smaller than her meant pretty much anything at all.

From a birds (or elephant's) eye view, they were trapped in the shape of a foot print. Not coincidentally, that foot print was a perfect match to Quaker's.

Quaker used her new ability to control and manipulate earth and mud, leaving the terrified humans with nowhere to run.

As she loomed over the crowd, her smile grew broader still.

"Look at this! What a collection of little foot massagers, all ready for me to play with!" she said with mock surprise.

Her excitement grew as she slowly lifted her right foot. She wiggled her toes in anticipation, knowing that nothing and no one could stop her. When suddenly, she gasped in shock!

"So? Who are you and what do you want with my city?" he asked bluntly.

"Over the countless centuries that I have walked this earth, I have adopted many names and titles. The Great One, The Destroyer, The Lord of All, and just to name a few. You, my adorable little whelp, my refer to me by my birth name: Oriana"

Pint Puncher rolled his eyes as she went down the list of her honorifics, though he had a hard time doubting their grandiosity given how strong she had proven herself to be. His attention was once again brought to her feet as she clenched and unclenched her toes repeatedly. He looked back at her face to find her staring intently at him. Her expression didn't seem to convey any hostility, though he felt unnerved at the way she looked at him. He had seen such an expression many times before, usually by his mother controlling foes. She was taking stock of him as though he were nothing more than a commodity for her to acquire and make use of.

"S-so, what brings you to Glam City?" the hero asked with a nervous chuckle as he hoped to get her mind off of whatever plans she had brewing.

"You speak as though I had chosen this particular piece of land to dominate. I've lived here long before your kind became the dominant species on the planet. While I slumbered in my bed chambers, your kind saw it fit to build your city above my resting place. Not that I hold that against you. You're not the first species to have shown such a callous disregard to your betters" she said before holding her hand up in a silencing gesture.

"This topic bores me. I would like to know more about you, little whelp. You've proven yourself to be the one of the stronger creatures I've encountered in my many years on this earth. Tell me, are there others like you that match your power?" she asked curiously.

Pint Puncher opened his mouth to respond, though he was stopped as a thought came to mind. The only people in Glam City who were capable of matching his power consisted of more than half of his rouges gallery. He didn't know what use Oriana would have with such knowledge, but he didn't think that he'd feel at all comfortable letting this tyrant know about them.

"No, I'm pretty much the only superpowered person out there" he said in the most convincing tone he could manage.

Oriana frowned as she eyed him thoroughly. She found his hesitation suspicious to say the least.
155333233212.title: ... lick her foot and hope that it appeases her.

choices: "I must rid the world of these humans"
"I must rid the world of technology, so that brute force can rule once more"
"If I cannot dominate humans with strength, I'll settle for just dominating YOU"
1553332332121.content:
The dragoness' gaze burned deep into the nervous hero, almost as if she were probing his mind for any signs of dishonesty. He half expected her to launch up from her throne and deliver yet another bone rattling blow to him as punishment, but instead she simply shrugged and leaned back into her seat with a bored look on her face.

"I suppose it wouldn't matter either way. All strength pales in comparison to my own, regardless of the time period. Speaking of which..."

She perked up and smiled slightly as she gestured for the Pint Puncher to come closer. He began to advance, but was stopped by her sudden icy glare. Somehow, without even uttering a single word of instruction, he knew what was expected of him. He moved without hesitation, dropping down to his knees before the fierce being before him. With that, her affable smile returned as she bent over and patted the top of his head in an oddly affectionate manner.

"Tell me more about the world as it is now. I imagine you must be a part of the dominant species, yes?" she asked curiously.

"I... guess so? It depends on what you mean. There are other creatures that are bigger, stronger, and faster than humans, but we're on top of the food chain" the hero explained as he began to unconsciously lean into her a massive hand. As condescending as it was, it was pleasant in a way that he couldn't quite describe.

"Really? Seems contradictory to me. How can you be the apex species if you aren't the strongest?"

"By being the smartest species. As time went up we made tools for hunting and much much more" the Pint Puncher boasted. He felt a small tinge of pride at the fascinated look on the dragoness' face as she listened to him talk about achievements of the human race. She listened in rapt attention as he went on to give her a brief rundown on the history of the world in how it related to humanity, occasionally cutting in with a follow-up question that pertained to what he was talking about.

After roughly an hour of discussion, she rose to her feet and sighed.

"Much as changed since I have slept. The power dynamics have shifted considerably, with the feeble domineering over the strong. I can't help but find it troubling..." she muttered as she stepped over the Pint Puncher and slowly walked over to the entrance of her home.

"What do you mean?" the Pint Puncher asked concernedly. Somehow, it only just then dawned on him that feeding all powerful conqueror information on the outside world might've been a bad idea. It was as though a haze at been over his mind and once she was done speaking to him, it had cleared up and he was able to realize his folly.

"If what you say is true, than my strength is no longer sufficient in order to dominate others. These 'humans', they've thrived due to their cunning and ingenuity... that might just be the only thing that my might cannot overcome" she said as she folded her arms, her wings flapping in what the Pint Puncher assumed to be a display of irritation.

"Why do you even need to dominate others anyway?" he asked as he stood to his feet.

"It is my role to do so, my precious little whelp. I do it not for my personal enjoyment..." she paused as she looked away with a wide smirk. "...although I do find it extremely satisfying..." she snickered before turning her attention back forward, her face becoming serious again. "I am a force of nature. I hold no ill will to the feeble creatures I conquer. I am not evil, I just am"

"So... what do you plan to do?" the Pint Puncher asked as he clenched his fists. It didn't matter how powerful Oriana was, he refused to sit back and allow her to reek havoc on the world. The towering dragoness pursed her lips in thought before turning around to look at him.

"The answer is quite clear, isn't it?" she began with a chuckle. Her next words sent chills down the hero's spine as she spoke in a nonchalant manner:

Several minutes went by before Shenny was able to depart from her ever growing crowd of fans. Most of them were innocent enough, beseeching her for an autograph or asking her to take a photo with them. There were a select few that wanted a bit more though. They seemed dead set on getting her to channel her old habits, as they begged to be stepped and used as her seat cushion. It didn't happen too often and she turned them down every time, but the temptation was always there in the back of her mind.

Her attention turned to Tiffany who seemed have an extra kick in her step as they walked down the busy shopping district. She could hardly blame her for being so ecstatic. The wolfess could never forget just how proud she felt upon meeting her first fan. She considered it to be the defining moment in her super hero career, the moment where it all became worth it. It felt good to see her friend enjoying such a moment.

Tiffany lead her friend all through the mall, often stopping to browse a clothes store. Shenny didn't quite share her enthusiasm as she perused each shop, mainly in part to her lack of interest in clothes. Tiffany was much more accustomed to wearing clothing than her, especially due to the environment she worked in. More than a few times the mouse would show off a tank top or a blouse to her and Shenny's replay would be in the form of a half-hearted compliment or a shrug. The giddy rodent never seemed to catch on however, as she continued to skip from shop to shop with her purchases hanging from her large fingers. Just when it seemed as though the rest of Shenny's day would be spent watching her friend buying clothes, something completely unexpected happened.

"Excuse me? Miss Shenny?"

The wolfess blinked, her ears immediately perking up at the familiar voice coming from beneath her. She looked down and beaming at the young man standing at her feet. It was none other than the fan she had met the day she had fought Felicia. He was bit more formally dressed than before, wearing a grey business suit with a camera hanging from his neck.

"Hey there! I haven't seen you in a while!" she said excitedly.

"You... you recognize me?" the young man asked, his heart soaring and his face turning bright red.

"Of course I remember you. It's kind of hard to forget your first fan" she said with a giggle as she patted the top of his head. "So what've you been up to? You haven't been getting tangled up with anymore super villains, have you?" she asked teasingly.

"No no," the young man laughed as he rubbed the back of his arm bashfully. "Though I've had more than a few close calls. The boss pays top dollar for high quality photos, so being in the line of fire is almost a necessity for me"

"What, are you a photographer or something?" Shenny asked curiously.

"More of a reporter. Not a lot of people are willing to put themselves at risk when it comes to reporting on all the villains in the city, so I have to pick up the slack for them" he said as he pushed his chest out proudly.

Shenny chuckled at his bravado. It certainly wasn't misplaced, given how bold he had proven himself to be in the past. Despite all the risks, he had dared to venture out with Felicia on the prowl just to try and get an autograph from his favorite heroine, and from what the Pint Puncher told her, he didn't even think twice before back-sassing the dangerous vixen.

"That's mighty impressive. Just be sure that you don't get too overconfident. I'd hate for something to happen to my number one fan~" She cooed as she patted the top of his head. The young man laughed and adjusted his tie bashfully.

"You flatter me, Miss Shenny, but I'm not covering any villains at the moment. I was actually looking for you"

"Really?" Shenny asked with a raised brow. "I guess I can see why. When you go from being a villain to a hero, people are gonna wanna know why" she said with a smirk. "Ask me anything. I'm an open book"

"You misunderstand. I'm not here for an interview. See, ever since we began covering glam city's villains in our publication, we've had an increase in young male viewership. The boss decided to capitalize on our spike in readership by making section dedicated specifically to anthropomorphic beings, like yourself"

"How is that any different then now?" Shenny asked.

"Well... we want to cater to our new demographic, so our new project needs to be much more... *cough* racy, if you catch my meaning" the man said as he tugged on his shirt collar uncomfortably, his growing more and more red as he spoke.

Shenny's smirk turned into a wide grin. She remembered her boyfriend talking about her potentially being on posters hung up on the walls of every teenage boy in the city, a thought that she took an immediate fancy to. She stood up to her full impressive height and placed a hand on her hip. Even from so high above, she could easily spot the tent forming in the reporter's pants as he eyed her body.

"No, I don't think I know what you mean. Would you be so kind as to spell it out for me?" she asked as she cocked her hip to the side. She struggled to keep from laughing as he looked her up from head to toe, sweat forming on his brow as he was no doubt fantasizing about her.

"I... I-I would like you t-to um... be our pinup girl..." he stammered nervously. He winced as Shenny's hand came down and yanked him from off the ground by his collar.

"I would love to~" Shenny sang happily before giving him a quick kiss on the top of his head before placing him back down.

The reporter staggered a bit as her kiss left him feeling flustered. He adjusted his suit and cleared his throat as he tried to collect himself, though his air of professionalism was slightly undermined by the boner he sported.

"We're happy to have you on board with the project, Miss Shenny. With you signed on, our success is a guarantee"

"I'm always happy to please my fans. And it's just Shenny. No Miss" she said with a chuckle. That brought another thought to mind. "Now that I think about it... you never did tell me your name. Seems wrong for me to not know the name of my number one fan!"

"Forgive my rudeness. My name is--"

"Cole!!"

Shenny blinked and looked over to see Tiffany running up to the young reporter, her arms filled with shopping backs. She squealed in glee as she hugged him tightly, his face being mashed against her breasts as she ragdolled him.

"I haven't seen you in sooooo long! Why haven't you been visiting the institute? I've been dying to talk to you!" she cried happily.

"Tiff... you might wanna ease up a bit" Shenny snickered.

Tiffany blinked and looked down to see the young man pushing against her stomach to free himself. As pleasant as her breasts felt, it was hard to focus on that when the air was being forced out of his lungs. She loosened her grip and let him fall onto the ground. She smiled sheepishly as she watched him gasp for air before standing up and brushing himself off.

"Yes, it's... good to see you too, Miss Tiffany" the man said with a weakened smile.

"Shenny, this is my friend Cole. He used to come around to interview the staff. Miss Wong didn't like him being around the lab, but he'd come around and talk to me every now and again" she said as she wrapped and arm around the shy young man.

"We've met. He was just asking me to be a pinup girl" Shenny said as she ran a hand down her side.

"No way! That is so awesome" the mouse exclaimed before she looked down at Cole with a playful pout. "If it's anthro girls you wanted, you could'a always come to me" she whined.

"I tried pitching you, but the senior editor insisted on Shenny on account of her notoriety. If all goes well and we hit the sells we're looking for, you'll be the first person I come to for the next issue" he said with a bright smile.

"That sounds good, but why not use the both of us?" Shenny suggested. "I understand why they'd want me, but I don't see why Tiffany can't be on board too. She's done her part in helping us fight crime in the city, what with her and Dr. Wong making gadgets for us" Shenny said folding her arms.

"Shen, it's fine. I was just teasing" Tiffany said with a chuckle.

"Nah, I want you to do this with me. You and Wong don't get nearly enough credit for everything you do for us. It's only right that I share the spotlight with you. Besides, being in a magazine is great... but being in a magazine with my best friend is even better" she said before looking down at Cole. "What do you say? Think you can fit her in?"

Cole sighed and scratched his chin as she thought it over.

1553332333333322112131321112122211111111.content:
The photographer could see the eagerness on both heroines' faces. He furrowed his brow and thought about how to keep everyone happy.

"Alright, I can handle a shoot with both of you, but knowing my senior editor he'll probably stick to mostly using Shenny's pictures. But if it's a hit the next issue will probably feature a lot of group shots. Now then, let's head for the parking lot, so we've got some space to work with."

Tiffany was excited just to be part of the shoot, but Shenny was still a little peeved to see her friend get sidelined like that. Did these guys not see the same wildly attractive mouse girl that she saw? Plenty of fans were ogling her as much as they were staring at the wolfess herself.

"Fine. But if there's no pictures of Tiffany at all I'm coming over to your head office to give that editor of yours a piece of my mind." Shenny grumbled.

"Duly noted." Cole stammered in response. Though he was her biggest fan, it didn't take much for the large wolf to send a chill down his spine. He guided the pair outside and directed Shenny for the first few shots. She was a natural at finding alluring poses for him to photograph, showing off her titanic curvaceous body. She grew and shrank to help add to the perspective. It didn't take long before the wolfess could even spot a little bulge in his pants. Seems like she was giving him exactly what he was looking for. And if everything went right, her beauty would soon adorn this whole city. She couldn't wait to get her friend a taste of that limelight too.

Over to the side the mouse girl had filled a few parking spaces with all her bags, mulling over what to wear for her pictures. At times she'd also watch Shenny make merry with the camera, giving her everything. Modeling seemed to come so easy to the wolfess. Tiffany was finally called over when Cole had filled up his camera's first memory card.

"I don't know about this Shen, I can't even decide what to wear." She said with a blush.

"You're doing pinups for horny teens. I think 'less is more' definitely applies here. Just imagine you're trying to seduce Punchy. Show yourself at your hottest, I know you can do it." The wolfess encouraged her, giving her a comforting hug.

Tiffany found her confidence and strode up to the spot. Cole was ready for her, but he didn't expect the mouse to start off by shedding nearly everything she was wearing. He took plenty of pictures as she undressed herself until only a thin bikini bottom was left to give things the slightest air of modesty.

"That's the spirit! You're doing great!" Shenny yelled from the sidelines.

Feeling brave, the mouse girl threw her everything into showing herself off like she'd just seen her friend do. She played to her great size, even picking up the photographer to provide some unique perspectives to her towering form. It helped that she knew Cole from before, as any other reporter/photographer might've wet himself with fear in her grasp. After a copious amount of shots of her tits and ass she set him back down, blushing a little. Tiffany wasn't used to exposing herself like this, but it certainly drew attention to her. On the edges of the parking lot several enamored fans were watching the whole thing intently.

"Great stuff so far. Now let's get a few with both of you together." Cole said, feeling excited about the possibilities. The two titans took to the group shots with gusto, finding all kinds of dramatic and arousing poses. They capped it off by letting the amassed fans in on one last shot of the two of them standing firm to protect them from evil.

"Awesome. I dare my editor not to use those." The photographer boasted whilst packing away his gear. Tiffany slipped back into her regular attire and got ready to take her bags and perhaps head back home with Shenny. There were only a few shops left unvisited, but she'd already found so many nice things. In the middle of it all she felt the wolfess' hand on her shoulder. Shenny whispered in her ear and a big smile curled up onto her face. The mouse girl let out a devious giggle before approaching Cole.

"Thank you for agreeing to take pictures of me too. I reckon that sort of kindness should be... rewarded." She said seductively.

Cole grinned, seeing her reach down to grab him again. He quickly put down his gear and let Tiffany do her thing. He could already guess what was about to happen as her large pursed lips closed in. Suddenly a shadow rose up behind him as Shenny had snuck in to 'assist' her friend. The photographer found himself getting smooched from both sides, warm breath washing over him as the two set about rewarding his work in the one way they knew all men appreciated. Their king-sized kiss smothered his whole head for a few seconds. Tifanny could feel his excitement, a tiny bulge poking into the palm of her hand.

"Mwah! There. I reckon that oughta do it. If you need us for another session, feel free to visit by the I.S.E.A. I'm sure something could be arranged." Tiffany mused as she set Cole back down. Already her mind was spinning with other possibilities. Maybe some action shots with the Pint Puncher too. Or maybe they could show the latest crop of villains turned to heroes. It would help to get the word out that not every superpowered animal is a villain these days. Then again, with all the irredeemable cases still locked up in their cells, it was probably better not to be too hasty with this. It took time for people to warm up to Shenny and her.

They parted ways with the mouse girl still mulling things over. But opposite to Tiffany's ponderous staring Shenny's smile couldn't be bigger. Her dream of being adored by many was another step closer as soon posters of her would spread through Glam City. And her friend was there along for the ride. This day couldn't get any better.

1553332333333322112131321112122211111111.content:
"How do you think it'll come out good? I might've overdone it with the low angle shots. I wanted to show my tits off, but I don't want people thinking I'm some kind of floozy. I am a representative of the institute, after all"

Shenny smirked as her friend prattled on excitedly. Whether or not Cole made good on his word to push for Tiffany's involvement in the project, seeing her in such high spirits made it worth it all the same. Of course, that didn't make her previous threat any less sincere. Her current occupation prevented her from heading over to their offices and ripping the roof off to get her hands on the senior editor, but given her intimidating size, she wouldn't have to do much but stand outside his office window and glare at him.

"Shen? Are you even listening? Come on, this is super important! I wanna make sure Punchy likes all the outfits I got" the mouse whined as she patted her on the shoulder.

"I told you they looked good when you first tried them on. Doesn't my opinion amount to anything?" Shenny asked with a smirk.

"Yeah, but you're only said that because you were bored and wanted to leave!" Tiffany answered back with a pout.

Shenny sighed and rubbed the back of her head with an embarrassed smile She had hoped that Tiffany would take notice to her disinterest, but she wasn't exactly the most subtle actor.

"True... but that doesn't mean I wasn't being honest"

"Oh, whatever. You were just trying to be friendly" Tiffany said as she rolled her eyes . She blinked as Shenny's expression soured as though she had just been insulted.

"Tiff, you really need to stop putting yourself down like that. Someone who looks like you has no business being so self-conscious" she said shaking her hand.

"Can you blame me though?" Tiffany asked with an awkward laugh. "How can someone not feel like a Plain Jane standing next to a knockout like you?"

"Tiff..." Shenny began with a heavy sigh. "You wanna know why I don't care about the clothes you picked out? As far as I'm concerned, you're the most attractive woman I've seen in this city. You putting on all those outfits means nothing to me, because I'd honest prefer seeing you without clothes at all"

Tiffany was left speechless at her praise, her face turning a bright shade of red. As often as she received compliments from her peers at the institution, they didn't carry as much weight as Shenny's. She'd always been envious of her friend's beauty, going as far back as when the two of them first met. Just looking at the wolfess' perfect curvature and flawless physique was enough to make her feel inadequate. For such glowing statements to come from someone as beautiful as her, Tiffany couldn't help but feel flattered.

Shenny smiled and patted her friend on the shoulder before continuing on her way. She wasn't lying when she said what she said, but part of her was trying to make up for all she had said during their time as villains. The two of them would squabble often, and that usually led to them trading insults back and forth. More than a few times, Shenny had made cracks about the mouse's weight, something she was very much ashamed of in hindsight. In truth, she was a bit jealous of Tiffany's massive tit and plush ass. She certainly wasn't lacking in that department herself, but she always admired how the mouse was able to topple buildings with the sheer force of her impressive rack.

The trip back home was punctuated by an awkward silence, save for the few times the two stopped to wave to a fan. Tiffany kept her face forward, though she would occasionally steal a glance at Shenny. She wanted to say something, to bring attention to wellspring of emotions bubbling up in her stomach, but she found it difficult.

"Hold on a minute..." Shenny muttered as she came to a stop. She squinted her eyes as she examined their current location. Tiffany was about to question her when the wolfess' face suddenly lit up with a bright smile. "I know where we are!" she cried excitedly before grabbing onto Tiffany's hand and pulling her along as she trotted down the street in the direction of the city shoreline. Once they arrived, she turned to Tiffany and gestured to their new environment.

"Doesn't this place ring any bells?" she asked before walking over and sitting down in the sand and letting her feet soak in the water.

"I... can't say it does" Tiffany responded as she examined the area. Aside from them, the shore was devoid of activity.

"This is where we first met! Remember? I had just gotten through weekly rampage and I came here to wash up" she explained before turning and and pointing to the sidewalk leading up to the shore. "You called out to me from over there. You said that you didn't want another giant muscling in on your turf"

The finer details of the incident remained a mystery to Tiffany, though the mention of Shenny bathing was more than enough to jog her memory. Like Shenny, she was just coming off a recent crime spree, her body aching as she just barely managed to come out on top against the Pint Puncher, his body left in a giant ass shaped crater downtown. Her near loss put her in a sour mood and was still itching for a fight. Shenny just happened to be at the wrong place at the wrong time... although given the outcome of that fight, the opposite might've been true.

"It's coming back to you, isn't it? Our first fight" Shenny said with a grin.

"Yeah. I can still feel it in my jaw" Tiffany giggled as she sat down beside her. "You've got to admit, I didn't do half bad for someone who just got through fighting Punchy"

"True. Funnily enough, if you'd told me that you were keeping Punchy busy, we would've been friend much sooner" Shenny said, giving her playful jab on the arm.

"Huh... that never even occurred to me until now. Hindsight's twenty twenty, I guess" Tiffany said with a shrug,

Shenny nodded and turned her attention to the water rippling against the shore. She wasn't accustomed to such a quiet and serene setting. It was the perfect atmosphere to pause and reflect, two things that she rarely made time for, if ever. She thought about the direction her lie had suddenly taken and it dawned on her just how much she had to be thankful for. She had a loving boyfriend, a wonderful job, and the respect and adulation of a decent portion of the city. If she were to go back in time and tell her past self that she would later have all these things and more, her past self would no doubt scoff at the notion. Her old self was concerned with tending to her petty hungers and would've been incapable of appreciating such a thing.

"Hey Shenny"

The amazon was broken from her thoughts as she turned to face Tiffany. Judging by the wistful expression on her face, she too had taken time to reflect on things. She turned to Shenny and smiled, a light blush touching her face as she took a moment to organize her thoughts.

"What do you think of me? Like... overall?" she asked softly.

Her caught Shenny for a loop as she raised a brow at her. It didn't really require much consideration on her part, as she couldn't possibly have a higher opinion of her than she already did.

"Well... you're cute, you're funny, and aside from Punchy, I can't think of someone I care about as much as I do you" she said, patting the mouse on the shoulder. "What, are you feeling self-conscious again?

"N-no, I just... um... when you say 'cute', like... what do you mean? Do you think I'm mean my personality or...?" she asked before trailing off bashfully.

"Yes" Shenny answer back with a chuckle. "What's this all about, Tiff? If you're feeling a certain way, you know you can talk to me about it"

Tiffany sighed and nodded. She had hoped to slowly work up the nerve to speak her mind, but knowing Shenny, approaching the subject head on would prove much more effective.

"Shen. Do you think it's possible for us to be more than just friends?" she asked bluntly, her face growing red hot as she stared deeply into Shenny's eyes. Her stomach turned a bit when Shenny's only response came in the form of a blank stare. Had she crossed the line in trying to push their relation even further? Her fears were quickly dismissed as Shenny leaned in forward and wrapped an arm around her.

"What, we aren't already?" she chuckled before pulling her friend in for a deep and passionate kiss. This would mark the first and only time that their lips met without the Pint Puncher in the middle, though that didn't make it any less effective. After a minute, Shenny pulled back to catch her breath.

"Now that I think about it, we never did make it official, did we? I just assumed you had come to the same conclusion that I had" she teased.

"Well excuse me for not picking up on hints..." Tiffany said with a pout.

"Tiff, after everything we've done together, all the times we bathed together, all the times we slept in the same bed, all the times I've talked about how great your tits were, you really didn't pick up on anything?"

Tiffany huffed and folded her arms. When she broke it down like that, it was rather ridiculous for her to have assumed that her feelings wouldn't be reciprocated. Shenny laughed at her friend's indignant expression before giving her a quick peck on the cheek.

"I love you, Tiff. Is that better?" she cooed in a playfully condescending manner. Tiffany answered back with a kiss of her own, her eyes lit with glee.

"Very~" She murmured softly.

1553332333333322112131321112122211111111.content:
Tiffany quickly scanned the beach around them to make sure there were no stray humans to get in the way of what she had planned. When it seemed all clear she threw and arm around Shenny and surprised the wolfess by pulling her over. The giant mouse girl laid herself down in the sand, draping her friend on top of her.

"What the..." Shenny exclaimed before catching on to Tiffany's ideas. She let herself flop onto her friend and crawled forward a bit to reward that stunt of hers with a big loving smooch. Both titans closed their eyes and laid in a passionate embrace, kissing eachother like never before. But before this heated moment could go any further a loud voice cut through the air.

"Hah! This will be even easier than I thought. Shenny! My name is Tallio and I am here to kick your ass! I've taken on and beaten your dumb little boyfriend several times in the past and after I deal with you he'll never have the nerve to bother me again!" A reindeer man shouted at the two titans. He stood just over twice as tall as the average human, which still didn't put him past their kneecaps if they were on their feet. His tawny fur bristled as he stood confidently before them. They both looked at eachother, bemused by the spectacle, before addressing him.

"Have we met?!" Shenny asked, visibly confused.

"You're all over the news! A supervillain gone soft and helping these disgusting people. How can you look at these things and feel like they need protection?" Tallio gestured around him. Surrounding the deer were several copies of him, all frozen in place. He runs down and grabs another bystander to demonstrate his powers. He locks the man in a powerful bearhug before dissipating in a wisp of smoke, leaving behind an image of himself keeping the man pinned. Even the Pint Puncher's strength wasn't always enough to shatter these illusions. He let out a maniacal laugh, the two heroes already growing weary of his presence.

"Now feel my wrath!" The reindeer charged towards the two, but before he could get a swing in Shenny grabbed his head and pulled him off his feet. She got up a little, dumping the smaller villain on Tiffany's belly before letting herself slump down again. In an instant Tallio was slammed between two soft surfaces, the immense pressure pinning him in place. Even with his strength, all he could manage was useless wriggling.

"Simmer down! Once you've learned your lesson we'll let you out." Shenny said with a chuckle before turning her attention back towards Tiffany. "Now... where were we?"

The mouse girl giggles a little, feeling the villain tickle her belly. She reaches up and puts a hand behind Shenny's head, guiding it back into a lengthy makeout session. Every beachfront property in Glam City was treated to the sight of the two titans making out, but neither of them gave a damn. This was their moment, not to be interrupted by spectators and especially not upstart little supervillains who were in over their heads. As their vast bodies rubbed against one another they felt the reindeer getting squashed and rolled around between them. Soon his resistance petered out, but they weren't done yet.

Tallio is forced to endure more torment as Shenny and Tiffany attempt to catch up with years of unrequited love one lengthy kiss at a time. Though the idea of turning this into an ever lewder spectacle arises, the last vestiges of common sense still present steer them away from it. Perhaps something to get into back at home.

After nearly an hour of intimate playing on the beach the two finally decide they've had enough. The sun was quickly disappearing behind the horizon. Shenny sat up, laughing a little as Tallio's flattened form was revealed. He didn't move, too worn out from the relentless squashing he'd endured. The wolfess helped her friend back onto her feet and Tifanny gave the institute a quick call to pick him up.

"Now you're gonna wait here for the people of the I.S.E.A. to take you away and you'll be a good boy, understood? Otherwise I'll have to bring you there myself and I'll want to have some more 'fun' with you on the way there." Shenny growled menacingly, holding her victim in a tight grip. The reindeer man weakly nodded, humiliated by how easily the two titans dominated him. After her call the giant mouse girl went over to the trapped people near the pier. She easily overpowered Tallio's illusions, apologizing for not freeing the townsfolk sooner. Most of them didn't respond, but one guy shouted up: "After a show like that, take all the time you need!" Tiffany blushed brightly before joining up with her friend.

"Let's go home, Shen. I reckon your boyfriend has had quite enough time with Helen."

"Hah, he better. Though I wouldn't be surprised if they managed to do something dumb and get him stuck inside her somehow." Shenny said with a chuckle. The greedy hippo wasn't exactly known for her subtlety.

"Wanna bet? Winner gets Punchy for the night." Tiffany responds.

"After all that..." Shenny points over to the large indent they left in the beach. "...I think we should treat Punchy to two giant bodies to sleep between." A reaction that draws a gleeful squeak from the titanic mouse

Before they leave Tiffany hurriedly straightens up the beach to remove most traces of their amorous session. Only a few large footprints are left behind when the two finally choose to leave. They quickly reach the edge of the forest and share a few more kisses on the way to Shenny's home. When they arrive...

1553332333333322112131321112122211111111.content:
Though the two giants arrived home in high spirits, Shenny couldn't help but be a bit on edge. She trusted her boyfriend to keep things under control in her absence but Helen had proven herself to be a chaotic element. Her amicable attitude could've easily been a facade to lull them all into a false sense of security. It was an troubling thought to be sure, yet Shenny found the prospect of her betrayal less rage inducing and more somber as she felt a genuine connection building between the two of them from their time spent alone together.

Shenny and Tiffany stepped into the room expecting the worst, but were both pleasantly surprised as they found Helen sitting on the table with her legs crossed. The Pint Puncher was no where to be seen, oddly enough. Helen blinked as she turned to greet the two with a bright smile. Her fun with the Pint Puncher had improved her mood considerably and it showed.

"Hey there. You two were gone for a while. Brought back anything interesting?" she asked curiously. Tiffany beamed as she began digging through her bags. She was excited to have someone take an interest in her purchases. Before she could begin gushing about all the dresses she bought, Shenny spoke up.

"Where's Punchy?" she asked as she narrowed her eyes at the hippo.

Helen rolled her eyes and sighed as she stood to her feet. Shenny's expression shifted from suspicion to surprise as she found her boyfriend squashed flat as a sheet against the hippo's naked ass, his body perfectly conforming to every curve and contour. Helen looked up at her with a sheepish smile as she went to work peeling him off.

"Before you get your panties in a wad, this was his idea" she explained.

Shenny was stuck for something to say as she watched her boyfriend's body gradually reshape itself. She knew to take Helen's word with a grain of salt, so she would trust him to verify. Once he was whole again, he stumbled to his feet and shook his head to try and collect himself.

"The idea was... to try and build... a tolerance to gas based enemies" he panted. The smell of Helen's sweat was burned into his memory for all time, though his hardened cock made it clear that this wasn't an inconvenience for him.

"He gets an advantage over baddies, I get to use him as a seat cushion. How could I turn down an offer like that?" Helen asked with a smirk.

The others couldn’t hear the very faint buzzing her communicator, but she could feel it vibrating in her cleavage. She pulled it out and spoke on it for a minute before turning her attention over to Pint Puncher.

“Hey Punchy! Miss Wong just called. She wanted to warn you that Hank is attacking the city, so you’d best prepare for his mind controlling musk. Do you still have the gas mask she made for you?”

The hero’s eyes narrowed at her question, his face burning bright red with embarrassment. The very last time he used the gas mask, it was against Hank. For the most part it worked, but a stray blow from one of his brainwashed zombies managed to send it spinning around his head. Hank was quick to take advantage. He’d managed to squeak out a victory, but not before enduring some hardcore humiliation. His throat ached just thinking about it.

“You tell her I’m not going anywhere near Hank until she sends me the hazmat suit she promised me” the hero stated sternly as he folded his arms.

Her response came as a surprise to the hero. It wasn’t at all like Wong to take such initiative. Usually he had to approach her for aid and even then she had to be coerced or bribed into it. This particular case must’ve been a higher priority than all others, though he wasn’t certain why. He heard Helen snickering from behind and turned to see her with a lecherous smile on her face.

“Hank huh? I wonder why she’d want him around…” she laughed.

It didn’t take a genius to grasp what she was insinuating. He was still on the fence as to whether or not he bought into what she had said about the doctor, but he couldn’t bring himself to completely dismiss the idea. If it was true, it made perfect sense for Hank to be a high priority for her. He wasn’t proud to admit it, but he’d seen what the villainous badger was packing in that thong. He shook his head as his mind began to bring him unpleasant memories of being on his knees at Hank’s crotch. That was the last thing he needed to be on his mind before facing off against him again.

“Alright,” Shenny said as placing the magazine on the table and cracking her knuckles. “Let’s get this over with”

She didn’t get far before being pulled back by Tiffany.

“Whoa Whoa, where do you think you’re going? We’ve got not place in this fight!” she stated firmly.

“Don’t forget, Hank’s powers are pheromone based. You and I have no business being anywhere near him with such sensitive noses. He probably wouldn’t even have to get that close to use for it to affect us. Then he’d have two giants on his side”

“I see your point, but can’t Doctor Wong just whip us up some suits too?” Shenny asked incredulously.

Shenny frowned, though she couldn’t fault her logic. She was still fiercely protective of her boyfriend and didn’t like the idea of sending him off to deal with Hank alone. Sure, he might’ve bested him on numerous occasions, but luck didn’t always favor the hero in his fights. She looked down at her small lover who offered her a sympathetic smile. It was clear that he had arrived at the same conclusion as Tiffany. With a heavy sigh, the wolfess...

"Urgh, fine. You go get him, Punchy. But promise me you'll be extra careful!" She said with a weary groan. But as the last of her sentence left her lips an idea sprang to mind.

"Wait a moment, can't Helen go with you? She's used to bad smells due to her powers, so his musk would have less effect. And I bet she's got some more protection stashed in her old lair."

"You're not wrong, I should be able to handle that bastard with relative ease." Helen nodded with an increasingly big smile. Hank was reliant on his hypnotic stench, since he stood no taller than the average man. The hippo could already picture all the ways in which she could manhandle him and crush him into submission.

"What about his minions?" Tiffany asked.

"What about them? I'll just bump them aside with my big belly as I go for Hank. What are some mind-controlled humans gonna do to me?" The hippo scoffed. The giant mouse meant well, but she was getting a little overbearing for Helen's tastes. This was exactly the kind of drama that kept her from wanting to be a hero. Was it really that important that every last human was left completely unharmed?

"Then it's settled, Helen will help me against Hank. Have Wong redirect the drone to her old lair, we'll go there to grab her mask." The Pint Puncher stated clearly, eager to get going. He couldn't let the villainous badger have another moment of free reign in the city. As quickly as the hippo could go the two of them ran off to her hideout.

"Alright, this should do the trick." She said, rummaging around a little amidst the mess. The Institute had returned some of the tech she made after they were finished analyzing it. Now that Helen was going to be on their side, it only seemed practical to let the hippo have her gadgets. She retrieved a pair of strange looking plugs and jammed them in her nostrils. They went in so deep they were effectively invisible. Only an extremely heavy impact could knock those free. The Pint Puncher felt a little jealous, knowing that his solution was far less elegant. Almost on cue the drone came within earshot, landing just outside and delivering a small package. It was a modified spandex suit with a full mask.

"Oooh, wouldn't that have been useful all the times I subjected you to my farts?" Helen chuckled a little as she inspected the gear. The hero blushed, but he had an explanation. "Your stench isn't as dangerous. Sure, it's horrifyingly smelly, but it won't mind control me. Super endurance lets me shrug off the former, but is a lot more susceptible to the latter."

The hippo rolled her eyes, feeling only slightly insulted by the hero suggesting he could defy her gas. She had plenty of past battles to pick from in which she proved otherwise. But her attention was drawn so something different as she saw the hero enter her lair with the spare suit. Eagerly she followed him, knowing what was about to happen. The Pint Puncher realized that he was gonna have to change in front of her. With a girly giggle the hippo encouraged him.

"It's okay, I promise I'll look away." She cooed, blatantly lying. But the hero caught her by surprise by simply shrugging in agreement. Then it was his turn to smirk as he simply slipped into the suit without taking off his white spandex at all. Helen was surprised, then disappointed, but there were bigger things to worry about. She could always coerce the hero into some lewdness later.

The gas mask fit better this time, a clear improvement. The filter was also a little more compact, which hopefully meant it wouldn't me knocked around so easily, though a solid blow to the mask could probably still end in disaster. The two went as fast as they could to the source of the attack. They stopped when they could hear marching in the street. Carefully the hero peeked around a building to see what was going on. What he saw horrified him.

Hank had amassed a small army already and was using it to convert everyone in sight. He walked down the street, his servants moving in lock-step around him. Everyone the villain could see would get dogpiled by ten people and dragged towards the musky badger. There he would pick a smell at random to add the civilian to his ranks. Burps, armpit stench, even rubbing someone against his smelly dick. The Pint Puncher shuddered at the thought. Not just that smelly pole, but the insidious notion put in the back of his head that Dr. Wong was keen on having a go at said pole. He hadn't made up his mind on how much of Helen's story was true, but the mental images it conjured weren't pleasant. Before he can go in, a large hand on his shoulder stops him. He looks over to the hippo, who's got a smirk on her face.

"I've got an idea..." She whispered.

The foul badger halted his army as he saw Helen walk into the street before him. He had no beef with the hippo, they mostly kept out of eachother's way. But when he saw the spandex-clad figure draped over her arm he knew she was up to something. With his curiosity growing he called out to her.

"Hey there Helen, who's that you got there?"

"The one and only Pint Puncher." She said, holding the limp body of the hero up. She struggled to keep a straight face through this ruse, already amused by the potential result. The superhero played his part great, hanging defeated in her hand.

"Really now... and why did you bring him here?"

"I was wondering if you could give him a whiff of the good stuff and order him to be my slave."

Hank laughed loudly at the suggestion, commanding the people in front of him to get out of his way as he approached the hippo. He was still a little apprehensive though. "What's with the mask?"

"Heh, he thought he could resist my ass blasts with it. Unfortunately for him my ass is dangerous in more than one way and it didn't do much to stop him getting crushed unconscious. I was thinking you could fill those filters up with your special smells so they'll last even longer." Helen replied, impressed by her ability to make something like that up on the spot. The badger's curious brow finally lowered as he seemed convinced by her story. He nodded in agreement.

"Okay, give him to me and I'll take care of it for you." He answered with a cruel smirk. Whatever horrid plans he had in mind for the hero, making him a slave to Helen was definitely a good one. He stood no more than fifteen feet away from the hippo, waiting for her to hand over the hero.

Helen nodded and began to advance with the Pint Puncher still hanging limp in her grasp. Neither of them were at any real risk given their equipment, but the hero couldn't help feel uneasy being so close to Hank. In terms of physical strength he had the villain pegged, but all it took was a second for everything to go south. Once they were five feet away from Hank, Helen grinned and tossed the hero aside with seemingly no care to his safety. As many beatings as he took on a daily basis, a drop to the ground wouldn't amount to much, she reasoned.

"What's the deal? If you wanna mess around with him while he's got his wits about him, then-"

Before he could finish his thought, Helen cut loose with a powerful, skull rattling belch that sent him flying back several dozen feet. Despite her lack of concern regarding the civilians in the area, she wanted to start her career as a hero of without any unneeded casualties. Getting in close guaranteed that none of his drones would get caught in the blast. The didn't even react to her surprise attack as they stood idly by waiting for a command from their master. Helen wouldn't afford him the opportunity as she stomped towards the disoriented badger.

"Get the people outta here. I can handle this punk" she instructed.

The hero was slightly annoyed at her for taking charge of their mission but was quick to obey as he begun ushering the people away from the scene. She might've been reluctant to play the hero, but her cunning would ensure that no one got hurt. Relocating Hank's minions proved an easy enough task, as they did nothing to resist him. He made sure to deliver them out of earshot of their master just to be on the safe side.

Hank groaned and slowly stood to his feet, his head still reeling from Helen's surprise attack. Needless to say, he was feeling more than a little ticked at her for pulling such a stunt, but more than anything else he was trying to discern why she would even do this. They weren't particularly friendly with each other, but couldn't recall having done anything to warrant such hostility. The sound of her thudding footsteps brought him back to the present as he looked up to find Helen stalking towards him. Gritting his teeth, he jumped to his feet and readied himself for battle.

"Why don't you save us both some trouble and give up? Worse thing that'll happen is that you'll be locked in a cell and some horny nerd'll come and jump your bone every now and again" Helen said with a smirk.

Her comment left Hank flustered and confused as he stared blankly at her. From the corner of his eye he could see the Pint Puncher escorting his army away from their battle, using his super strength to grab them the dozens before flying off. Going by the snide grin on Helen's face, he could tell that he had a hand in her ploy. It was all too much for him to wrap his head around. He had caught wind that some of his fellow villains had chosen to turn over a new leaf and he had been preparing for the eventuality of having to face off against his former allies, but he never would've imagined that Helen would be among that select few.

"What did they promise you, Helen? Money? Power? What was so valuable that it'd make you side with him?!" he asked pointing over to the hero.

"Great sex and a roof over my head" she answered bluntly. She certainly wasn't being dishonest in her answer.

"Real fuckin' cute. You won't be joking when I have you worshiping the ground I walk on" Hank growled angrily.

Helen rolled her eyes and cracked her knuckles, her confidence making her foe visibly uneasy. She had no real reason to fear Hank. He could easily overpower the strongest human, but that meant little to her. The only thing he could rely on was his ability to congregate loyal servants and the Pint Puncher had ensured that there was no one around for him to convert. Still, Hank was more than a mindless hedonist. He utilize his wits when the situation called for it and he still had a few tricks he could call upon...

His angered growl was replaced by a short command.

"Assist me! Take these 'heroes' down!" He cried out at top volume. The hippo just smirked.

"They can't hear you." She takes a heavy step closer, ready to destroy the honey badger. But his smile didn't fade.

"They don't need to." He said, his voice thick with malicious glee. Suddenly it clicked for Helen. They might not be anywhere near her, but the Pint Puncher was probably back there, standing among them and not suspecting a thing.

"You'll pay for that!" She said gruffly, stomping towards Hank. The honey badger tried to dodge out of her way, but a large hand grabbed him by the shoulder and lifted him off the ground. He was pulled towards the hippo, her thick knee finding its mark in his gut. Helen let him stumble onto all fours, reeling from the tremendous blow. Before he could regain his bearings though, the supervillain found himself going up again. The hippo had grabbed his shoulder and his leg, hoisting him over her head.

"Call them off." She hissed angrily.

"Never." Hank replied bluntly. He didn't get a chance to taunt the hippo before he was thrown down in front of her, landing hard against the pavement. With what little mercy she might've had for him depleted Helen turns around, letting her humongous ass loom threateningly over the honey badger's downed form. Without any further threats of fanfare she sat down, smothering his whole body beneath tons of hippo ass fat. Like most villains, he was made of stern material and even with his relatively small size he was able to endure the impact, though the aftermath left him unable to do anything more than wiggling uselessly.

Helen was not done yet though. This bastard was going to pay for what he did to her lover. She grit her teeth and pushed out a powerful fart. Already she could hear footsteps closing in. His minions would soon arrive to harry her. With no time to lose the hippo let forth a squeaky volley of fumes that could strip paint. The useless struggles seized almost immediately, but she gave Hank a few extra blasts of her vile farts just to rub it in. Hopefully Dr. Wong had a nose clip ready for her visits to Hank, because this smell was gonna stick with him for a while.

The hippo's anger faded as she saw an inspiring sight. The Pint Puncher had managed to shake off the honey badger's minions and was flying through the air. He looked a little worse for wear, some small tears in his protective suit. But most importantly, his mask looked undamaged. As much as she daydreamed about dominating him back to his senses she was pleased to see Hank's ambush had failed. But as she let out the last potent blast she heard the rumbling of many footsteps closing in.

All at once the crowd escorted away by the superhero ran down the street towards her whilst every door opened up with even more minions pouring from them. The army in the streets was but a fraction of Hank's forces. She stood up, getting ready to endure the feeble attacks from these enthralled humans. Her thick skin would render it all useless, a slight tickle at worst. It also gave her a chance to admire the results of her overwhelming assault on the honey badger. The asphalt below her was cracked, a large star pattern converging right beneath her asshole showed the sheer concussive force she could unleash. Hank was laid out in the middle of it, his face right at the epicenter of those earthshaking blasts. His eyes had rolled up into their sockets and his breathing was shallow. Whether it was the stench or the weight that rendered him unconscious she didn't know, but Helen couldn't care less.

"Serves you right, asshole." She huffed, staring down the hundreds of minions amassing around her.

The crowd charged at the hippo without fear. Hank's grip on them was strong, even with him unconscious. As she expected the little fists slapped dryly against her skin, unable to do much more than create the slightest of jiggles in her flabby thighs, belly and rear. But as the minions' fervor reached a new high they began to crawl over eachother in a desperate attempt to pin Helen down. Like a swarm of insects they attempted to envelop her within their squirming mass. It actually sent a pang of fear down her spine. She could snap each of these useless little men and women in half or crush them to death by the dozens under her butt, but that wasn't an option anymore. Not if she wanted to keep close to the Pint Puncher. She needed to act fast before they could gain the upper hand.

1553332333333322112131321112122211111111.content:
Stress began to mount for Helen as the swarm of drones grew in number. Their attempt at offence was laughable, but she was growing increasingly irritated as she grabbed Hank and slug his limp body over her shoulder. She had no way of freeing herself from the hectic crowd, not without putting their lives at risk. She tried to shuffle past them, using her plump stomach to push them aside. It quickly became clear that her passive resistance was wouldn't work in this situation, as they would simply jump back up to their feet and make another attempt to rush her.

Helen sighed as she readied herself. She was hoping to not have to resort to this as she was certain that the hero would admonish her for it afterward. An ominous rumbling began to arise from her gut, though her attackers were more concerned with fulfilling Hank's commands than getting out of firing range. The Pint Puncher watched from a distance as the crowd was sent flying back with several of them falling to the ground unconscious. A visible cloud of gas hovered around the area and it wasn't long before the entire crowd was out cold.

Helen wiped the sweat from her brow and looked around at her handiwork proudly. Seeing the hero float over to her, she folded her arms and readied herself for the lecture that was to come. To her surprise, the hero approached her and gave her a pat on the shoulder.

"Great work! I can't remember the last time things went so smoothly!" he said in a chipper tone.

"S-Seriously? You mean it?" Helen stuttered. Despite her initial cynicism, her face lit up at her lover's approval. "You're not upset with me gassing them unconscious?"

"What other choice did you have? It's not like you seriously injured them or anything. They needed to be incapacitated and you managed to do it with zero casualties. That's something to be proud of" he said as he gave her another pat on the shoulder.

"Honestly, I can't remember the last time things went so smoothly. You have a real future in the superhero business, you know"

"Well... o-of course things well smoothly! Any plan orchestrated by yours truly is guaranteed to be a winner!" Helen boasted. Her attempt to sound haughty fell flat as she fidgeted with barely contained glee.

"Alright. Hows about we drop this bum off and go have some fun~?" Helen asked with a lecherous grin.

"Job's not done just yet, I'm afraid" Pint Puncher said gesturing pile of bodies. "We have to notify the Institute about all the people Hank enslaved so they can get to work on a cure"

"What 'cure'? I don't remember ever seeing you having to take anything after fighting Hank!" Helen said in a huff.

"True, but you have to keep in mind that I'm not like most people. A bit of blunt force trauma can bring me out the trace, but that's mainly because I'm superhuman. These people need something a bit more potent. Otherwise, they're just going to wake up as emotionless zombies, waiting around for Hank to tell them what to do"

When he saw that his explanation wasn't sitting well with Helen, he smiled and rubbed her arm affectionately.

"Once we're done with all this, I'll spoil you any way you like. That’s a promise”

Helen folded her thick arms and looked the other way, but it was hard for her to hide her growing smile. The hero snickered and reached into his pocket for his communicator.. No doubt the doctor was already working on a method to cure the citizens under Hank’s thrall. As his communicator came to life, he was with a voice much different than he was accustomed to.

“Hello? HELLO? Doc, how do you work this stupid thing?!” A masculine voice shouted over the other end.

“Get your finger off the answer button, you meathead!” The doctor’s voice called back from the background.

“It’s not my fault you didn’t teach me howda use operate your crap!” the male voice growled. It took the hero a moment to realize who it was Rowland he was listening to. What he was doing answering his call was a mystery, though part of him wondered if he had caught the two at an… “inappropriate” time.

“Puncher? You have Hank under wraps, right?” Rowland asked.

“Y-yeah, sure” The hero responded slowly, feeling very much confused as to what was happening.

“Great. Get over here so we can get him situated. Doc’ll have the cure ready by the time you arrive”

Before the hero could inquire as to what he was doing with the doctor, he shut the communicator off. He looked over to Helen who didn’t seem all that surprised. The two rounded up the unconscious civilians and using his super strength, he wrapped a light post around them to keep them from straying. With that done, they made their way over to the Institute with their catch slung over Helen’s shoulder. A group of workers met them at the entrance, dressed in hazmat suits not unlike the one the Pint Puncher wore. Their attention was on Helen the entire time, even as they were escorting Hank into the containment area. The hippo rolled her eyes at their caution, though she could hardly fault them for it. Few could boast the amount of collateral damage she had caused them in the past.

Heading into the institute, the two were greeted by none other than Rowland himself. Much effort had been put into cleaning him up, his usual lack of modesty absent as he was dressed in a pair of lab coat, a blinking silver collar, and a pair of jeans that was was a tad too small for him. The tightness of his trousers were such that it was hard to not take immediate notice to massive bulge in his pants leg.

“Eyes up here, pipsqueak” Rowland said with a cocky grin. The hero blushed and quickly darted his eyes upward. The cougar laughed at his before turning around and gesturing for them to follow. “Come on. Wong’s got a reward for you nabbing Hank. She’s had her eye on him for ages, so she’s feeling especially grateful”

“Oh, I bet she is…” Helen muttered.

The Punt Puncher flashed her a stern look as he nudged her. If she was going to be working with him, the last thing she needed to be doing was picking fights. The hippo simply shrugged as they continued to follow Rowland all the way to Doctor Wong’s office. To their surprise, Hank had already been placed under her care, his body stripped naked and placed in what appeared to be a containment chamber, his privates exposed as his thong had been stripped away from him. The hero quickly averted his eyes from his crotch, though not before catching a quick glance at the unconscious villain’s huge member. The doctor was seated at her work desk typing away as she pigged out on a large bag of cookies

“I thought I made it clear that I didn’t want her in my lab” she said sternly, somehow detecting their presence without breaking her gaze from the screen.

“Long time no see, Mia” Helen chuckled smugly. “I see you found another guinea pig to poke and prod. That always was your kink”

“I know you’re a stranger to this, what with you never having worked a day in your life, but this is what we call a ‘job.’ Most of us believe in earning what we have instead of taking away from people who did.” Wong said in her usual deadpan manner.

“Real high and mighty, considering you initially volunteered for this job. Waylon assumed that you were just really dedicated to science, but anyone with common sense can see that you’re just a horny little minx” Helen teased.

“Your projection would be endearing if it weren’t so pathetic. A sex hungry glutton like you has no business criticizing my work”

“Is that right?” Helen asked with a wide grin, clearly enjoying their verbal fencing.

The hero shook his head as the two went at it. He looked over to Rowland who was standing at the doorway, watching the two with much amusement. Immediately, the hero began to ponder as to how the doctor managed to get him under her employ.

“Hey Rowland. How long have you been working here?” he asked curiously, his voice kept low so the doctor wouldn’t hear them

“I started yesterday. What do you care?” Rowland asked with an annoyed grunt.

“Have you felt any different lately?” the hero pressed.

“I don’t know what you’re getting at. If you’re surprised to see me working here, I didn’t have much of a choice. Whenever Tiffany’s away playing with you and your little posse, she uses me to pick up the slack. So eventually she decided to give me an official position as her secondary assistant”

The hero nodded slowly. It was a reasonable enough explanation, though he was left unsatisfied.

“Although…” Rowland began, his face becoming serious for a moment. “I guess I’ve been a lot less horny lately. Considering the fact that I haven’t gotten my dick wet in ages, it’s pretty weird. I’ve also been having odd dreams on and off again” he muttered.

“What kind of dreams?” the hero inquired.

“The kind where I’m giving the doctor a real good dicking” the cougar said with a grin. “I guess being here’s really screwed my brain up, or something. The doctor in dreams isn’t anything like the real thing. She’s a real cumslut. Face down, ass up, begging for me to fuck her like bitch she is… her words, not mine.

“R-right…” the hero stammered, his face reddening slightly. “And… how often do you have these dreams?”

“When I first came here, it wasn’t too often. Now I have them every night” Rowland said with a shrug. "Gotta say, Dream Wong has a pretty nice body. Plump in all the right places..."

The hero nodded and placed a hand on his chin in thought.

The strangeness would only ramp up from there. The jovial atmosphere came to a halt the sounds of thudding footsteps echoed through the streets. The three giants jumped to attention in an instant as they were poised to protect their fans from the approaching threat. Their fans weren't the least bit concerned by the noise as they chattered excitedly amongst themselves. Getting to worship their hero's bodies was a treat in and of itself, but now they were going to see them in action!

Shenny tried to determine the approaching anthro with her sensitive ears. Loud enough to shake the ground yet light enough to avoid cracking the concrete. That would indicate that it wasn’t another giant approaching, most likely standing just above Helen in height. From around the corner, a large pig woman poked her head out and looked over to the wolfess with narrowed eyes.

“You! I knew I’d find you eventually, ya dang hussy!” she snapped as she stomped over to her with her hands placed on her wide hips. The crowd marveled at her generous assets, though her attention was focused squarely on Shenny.

“I’m sorry, do I know you?” the wolfess asked with a bemused smirk.

“The name’s Annie, and you’re the homewrecker that went and stole my man!” the pig said as she pointed an accusing finger at her.

“Excuse me?”

“Don’t play innocent with me, missy! It’s all I ever hear nowadays! Folks be talkin’ about the Pint Puncher and his new squeeze Shenny! I can’t believe you’d take him away from me when everyone knows that I had my eye on him!” she huffed, folding her arms as she continued to glare daggers at the giant before her.

“You aren’t even an official member of his fanclub! I’ve busted my behind for months working my way up to vice president and I haven’t seen you at any of our weekly charter meetings!”

“Look miss, I don’t know what you’re on about but if you want to start something with me, let’s not do it when there’s people around, okay?” Shenny said with a sigh. She had always been protective of her boyfriend and she didn’t appreciate someone trying to intercede with their relationship in any way. Annie’s attention shifted to the crowd of humans, her frustration fading away in an instant as she flashed them a friendly smile.

“Well hey there, little fellas!” she said kneeling down to the ones closest to her. Despite her status as a villain, the crowd greeted her with praise and compliments for her voluptuous figure, much to her delight. While she basked in their admiration, Tiffany pulled Shenny to the side to speak with her privately.

“Shenny, you might wanna let this one go… Annie’s not someone to take lightly” she whispered.

“You’re kidding right? That fatass?” Shenny asked with a chuckle.

“I’m serious, Shen. Annie is one of the few criminals that the institute has given up on trying to capture. She may be smaller than us, but she’s got an insane amount of strength. Every time she's been caught, she escapes in a matter of hours” she explained as she glanced over her shoulder to make sure she wasn’t listening.

“Lucky for us, she’s never been all that interested in causing trouble. The only time she commits crimes, she tends to leave the job half finished and with little to no casualties. She’s more concerned with getting Punchy’s attention more than anything else”

Shenny raised a brow and looked over at the chubby woman who had taken to posing for the horny crowd. It seemed with each passing day, more and more of her kind were falling for the hero. Thinking about it, she couldn’t help but be amused at the odd contrast. While her and Tiffany were acquiring a slew of human admirers, the Pint Puncher had unintentionally created an ever growing harem of anthros. She would’ve been jealous had he not assured her his loyalty after his time spent with Helen and Quaker.

“Ya'll are mighty kind, but my heart belongs to the Pint Puncher” the pig said politely.

“Come on, don’t be that way!” Rowland interjected with a grin, having just finished jotting down the phone numbers of his admirers. He didn’t really care about her infatuation with the hero, but he saw an opportunity to bring yet another villain to the side of good.

“It ain’t every day that these people get to be close to a hottie like you. Why don’t you give them something to brag to their friends about?” he prodded. His sweet talk sent her into a fit of giggles as she played with her pigtails. How someone so giddish and easily flattered managed to accrue a reputation of villainy was beyond him, but he was quick to make use of it.

“Isn’t that right, guys? Don’t be shy. Let Annie know what you really feel!”

The men in the crowd erupted with catcalls and perverse requests towards the bashful pig, causing her to blush brightly. They praised her powerful thighs, marveled at her massive rear and pleaded for her to remove her trademark bathing suit.

“Aw shucks, ya’ll sure know howda make a girl feel special!” she tittered. “Alright then! I ‘spose I can make some time for you fine folk!”

Rowland was pleased with himself as he watched her grab onto the human nearest to her and mashed his face into her breasts. He was about to throw out a suggestion when Tiffany reached over and grabbed him by the nape of his neck and pulled him over to her. She wasn’t the least bit amused by his stunt, her eyes narrowed as she scowled at him.

“What the hell do you think you’re doing? The last thing we need is to be inviting bad guys to mess with civilians!” she hissed. Rowland rolled his eyes and pulled himself free

“Hey hey, relax. It’s not like she’s some hardcore crimelord or anything. She’s about as menacing as a jaywalker. Besides, even if she were to act out of line, she’ll have the three of us to deal with, right?”

“That’s not the point, Rowland. It’s good that citizens are starting to become more receptive to our kind, but that also makes them more susceptible to being manipulated by anthros who haven’t reformed”

“Huh… I hadn’t thought of that…” Rowland muttered, scratching his head.

They looked back over to the crowd and watched as the eager sow indulged each request presented to her. One of her admirers had been stuffed inside of her bathing suit, his relatively small body outlined against it as his head was buried between her giant breasts with another fan being pinned against her backside. As they reveled in their positions, her other admirers were tirelessly massaging every inch of her body.

Her friends thought nothing of her fun and games, butTiffany was still very much concerned. Annie wasn’t an active threat, but she was well known for not knowing how to control her incredible strength. Apprehending her seemed the wisest course of action, yet she felt it unjust. She wasn’t hurting anyone at the moment and in fact, was welcomed by their fans with open arms. She thought it over for a moment and eventually decided to...
