"A little something to remember me by" he chuckled as stood back to his full height. once again leaving an echo behind as he walked away from the hero. The villain paused for a moment and looked out the crowd of civilians who where looking at their once unbeatable champion with sadness and disgust. He whistled to get their attention before nodding his neck in the direction of the city. He didn't need to give them any further instruction as they followed him from behind, fearful of inciting his wrath. Even the massive gym enthusiast was quick to obey as he waddled his way up to the group, his ass still thoroughly stretched out and aching.

Pint Puncher in the meanwhile was still in a daze as Tallio's oppressive musk seemed to seemed to completely grab hold of his senses. He would receive no respite from the stench this time, as the echo's shaft perpetually hovered near his face. The last time Tallio had left him at the mercy of his echoes, it took hours for them to fade away. Given his recent increase in power, there was a good chance that they would be able to last even longer. That prospect alone was enough to bring the hero out of his funk just a little bit as he couldn't imagine having breath in Tallio's musk for that long without going mad.

Looking past that dilemma, he was still pondering his next course of action once he was finally free. Given the discrepancy in their strength, he couldn't deny that Tallio had let him off easy. He had managed to him decimate before, so Puncher couldn't even fathom the damage he would case to him in his powered up state. Still, it didn't feel right to let the villain enslave the city he'd sworn to protect. Even if they saw him as a failure and a weakling, he couldn't let that stop him from fulfilling his role as their protector.

He labored over his decision for some time, fluctuating between his newfound fear of Tallio and his desire for redemption. Every time he became to psych himself back up, his subconscious brought his mind to the towering pillar of meat in front of him and his mind would be flooded with images of his body getting stretched far beyond its limits. What was even worse was how his body reacted so such thoughts, as his manhood throbbed with need.

Hours went by and eventually the Pint Puncher reached a decision...
1553332333333323322332111212211112111232.title: Tallio leaves the hero disgraced and humiliated

choices: The Pint Puncher was succesfull, Tallio is dazed and reeling!
The Pint Puncher was succesfull, but Tallio shrugged off the attack.
The Pint Puncher had struck an echo, Tallio ambushes him!
1553332333333323322332111212211112111232.content:
The superhero agonized over his decision for hours. But as his super endurance patched him up he began to feel something boiling deep within that he hadn't felt for a long time. A righteous anger of such seething intensity he couldn't lie still any longer. He cracked his knuckles and swung at the echo's looming manhood, striking it with enough force to shatter the echo. The Pint Puncher stood up, breathing heavily and feeling amped up. He couldn't stop, now more than ever. He refused to let this reindeer beat him. No matter the odds, he was the hero of Glam City and he would defend this city from all villains, no matter the cost.

First things first, he dashed into a nearby building and locked himself in a toilet. Minutes later he raced back out towards the supervillain, his belly emptied of all the horrid reindeer's seed. He was going to deliver mighty vengeance for every humiliation he suffered. Tallio was in for a punching that would enter into the city's legends. By the time the superhero was done with him the reindeer would beg to be taken to jail.

But rage alone would not be enough. The hero knew Tallio was now stronger than ever before. He needed something to tilt the odds in his favor. Perhaps the very thing that got him into this situation could now help him. The reindeer's insults stung, but one stuck out more than others. It was in no small part the Pint Puncher's arrogance that made him underestimate the reindeer. Tallio and his echoes had abused that to its fullest extent. But standing tall and empowered might lead him to the very same downfall. Hopefully the supervillain would be off guard, believing the Pint Puncher to have been dealt with. That might provide the window needed for a surprise attack. A powerful knockout blow could decide the fight before it even started. The superhero prayed to whoever listened that things would be so fortunate.

It wasn't hard to follow the trail of devastation left behind. Houses, suddenly abandoned as the supervillain had demanded tribute and obedience, adding the people to his horde of followers. Hopefully he hadn't forced too many of them to submit their power or Tallio might well become unbeatable. No. Nothing would be unbeatable today. The Pint Puncher would show everyone that there was nobody that could defeat him. Or he would die trying.

After only a few more streets he spotted his nemesis. Tallio was standing tall, holding a pose whilst people took pictures. He had his eyes closed and was basking in the attention. A more perfect opportunity would not present itself. The Pint Puncher accelerated to full speed and with two outstretched fists aimed straight at the villain's face he was about to make his heroic entry. Some might consider it a cheap shot, but after everything the reindeer put him through the hero felt no regrets.

The whole crowd gasps in unison as the superhero shoots in and clocks the reindeer straight in the face with a punch so mighty the shockwave shattered nearby windows and brought the onlookers down on all fours.
1553332333333323322332111212211112111232.title: Pursue Tallio.

choices: ... he gets distracted from the fight.
... he's invigorated from their cheers.
1553332333333323322332111212211112111232.content:
Tallio couldn't be happier with how things had panned out. Having demolished Glam City's greatest hero, the citizens were quick to bend to his will as he trekked through the city adding to his already sizable following. He had grown a great deal from their continued worship, nearly doubling in size since he'd last dealt with the Pint Puncher. After all he had done to the hero, Tallio thought that he would either cut his losses and go into self-imposed exile, or he'd be so psychologically damaged that he'd come back literally begging to be the reindeer's slave. So confident in his victory was Tallio that he didn't at all expect to be sent flying from what had to be the hardest blow he had ever recieved.

The attack was not only powerful enough to take the villain off his feet, but held more than enough force to send him careening through a nearby office building, For a few minutes, all Tallio could see was stars as he clenched his aching jaw. Did Glam City have some kind of superweapon that he didn't know about? With all the power he'd accumulated, he couldn't imagine what else could've been responsible for causing him such pain. As the dust cleared he expected to see a tank or perhaps some kind of organised militia, but instead he was greeted by the familiar sight of the Pint Puncher.

"You..." the reindeer grumbled as he dug himself out of the rubble and staggered to his feet. His anger waned upon looking at the Pint Puncher's face and seeing the white hot fury that laid beneath his gaze. Tallio could practically feel the bloodlust oozing out of every pour on the hero's body as he simply hovered in place with his arms folded and for what must've been the first time in his life, Tallio felt uneasy.

"You've got a lot of nerve showing your ugly mug around these parts. Especially after I exposed you for the pitiful little nothing that you really are" he sneered before gesturing over to his enslaved followers. "See all those people? They didn't even hesitate when I offered them the chance to surrender their energy to me. Word spreads fast in Glam City, and when they heard about our little scuffle, they were more than willing to turn their backs on you. And you want to know why?"

Tallio leaned in and narrowed his eyes, malice dripping off of every word he spoke.

"You. Are. Weak. This city doesn't need a defender that's just going to beg and plead for mercy when things stop going his way in a fight. But by all means, if you want to disappoint them even more, feel free to stick around. As nice as it feels having a whole gaggle of sluts on their knees worshiping my dick, none of them can measure up to you. Your heroics are laughable but you can work my meat like nobody's business"

That was all the Pint Puncher could take. Enduring Tallio's taunts was bad enough but him dredging up the memories of his humiliating defeat pushed him over the line as he let loose a mighty roar and charged onward. This sudden outburst caught Tallio off guard, leaving him no time to prepare as the hero's fist collided with his chest. The diminutive hero fought like a man possess as he landed blow after blow, the intensity of his attacks sending shockwaves through the city streets. Tallio gritted his teeth and swung blindly at his attacker, desperately trying to get a grip on him and cease this assault, though each attempt either resulted in the hero dodging his hands or simply batting them away with his superhuman strength.

Off in the distance, the citizens of Glam City watched the battle in awe and admiration. Several of them bore witness to their hero's brutal defeat and to see him getting the better of Tallio was more than enough to renew their trust in their hero. Some called out words of encouragement, cheering on their valiant champion as he fought and from their it quickly blossomed into uproarious praise and support for him.

Such an enthusiastic display did not go unnoticed by the Pint Puncher as...
1553332333333323322332111212211112111232.title: The Pint Puncher was succesfull, Tallio is daze...

choices: Tallio misses, the Pint Puncher scores a critical hit
Their fists meet in an explosion of raw power
Tallio strikes true and knocks the Pint Puncher out
1553332333333323322332111212211112111232.content:
The cheers and compliments soothed the hero's aching ego, but Tallio was not far and ready to strike down his nemesis with cold reality. A brutal backhand clocked the hero across the face, sending him rocketing into a nearby building. Driven beyond all his limits, the Pint Puncher stood up and flew back out menacingly, rubbing his cheek a little before cracking his knuckles. The reindeer was not impressed.

"I see what you're doing here, boy. You puff up your chest and pretend to be a big man, but it's all smoke and mirrors. You're still as weak as ever and when it comes to being big I've got the upper hand." The supervillain stands grand, proudly showing off his towering new height. "And if you think such weak illusions will hold me back, you haven't been paying attention!"

Tallio stepped forward, leaving an echo behind like a statue for his worshippers to admire. The villain barely even noticed or cared that he'd stepped on a handful of his worshippers that were too slow to get out of the way. The hero tried to charge again, but this time the reindeer sidestepped him, leaving an echo for the Pint Puncher to collide with. Having fought the dastardly reindeer before the superhero started to get wise to his tricks, avoiding the impact and soaring around the echo for another attack. Like an angry mosquito clad in tattered spandex he whizzed around Tallio's head.

"Hold still you little pest! What are you going to do?! Annoy me into submission?!" The villain yelled, increasingly frustrated. He flailed around wildly, occasionally smacking a building and taking a large chunk out of it if not reducing it to rubble completely. Though the hero struck true over and over again the reindeer had a point. None of his blows seemed to leave any lasting damage. Whether it was the hero's doubts or just blind luck will remain a mystery, but out of the blue one of Tallio's wild swings connects. The hero is quick to recover, but he knows he's on his last legs. With far too little time to recover he feels his muscles ache. No amount of cheering could overcome the fact he's running on fumes after fighting the evil reindeer two times already today. Another big hit like that and he might not be able to get back up before the villain is upon him. And if Tallio managed to grab him it'd be game over.

There was nothing else for it. He had to give it every last scrap of power he had. A shattering blow that would end this fight here and now. A knockout punch so hard even the reindeer's thick skull wouldn't be able to protect him. The Pint Puncher let out a mighty warcry so loud all nearby windows rattled. Tallio was taken aback by this display of power, but he could see the beads of sweat on the hero's forehead. This was his desperate last hurrah.

"Bring it, you pathetic excuse for a hero!" The villain roared. He loosened his arms and prepared a mighty swing himself. If that obnoxious brat thought he could go toe to toe with him he was going to prove the hero dead wrong. He had grown tall enough that his fists were bigger than the hero's whole body. He thought for an instant about all the other parts of him that were now bigger than the hero's whole body, but those musings would have to wait until after he'd secured his victory here.

The Pint Puncher shot towards the reindeer in an explosion of sheer force, blowing all nearby windows to splinters. Tallio leaned back and threw a mighty punch himself, aiming to meet the superhero's outstretched fist. The reindeer would prove that even with all the yelling in the world the hero was still nothing. Nobody that saw the spectacle dared to even breathe, watching these two forces of nature collide.
1553332333333323322332111212211112111232.title: The Pint Puncher gets distracted from the fight.

choices: Lipstick Stars
Other
15533323333333233223322.content:
Incoming a supervillain team-up!

Lipstick Stars - a group of villainesses proudly brandishing lipstick-painted lips and powerful curves. These villainesses met up with one goal: to defeat the Pint Puncher and claim him as their own slave. The members are as follows:
-Paula, "The Warden" - The infamous warden of the gang, Paula comes with her normal attire, usual black fur and black latex suit, as well as cherry red lipstick. Her gang gave her more rubber that she can manipulate, with which she typically uses to trap her victims in jails made of rubber. One of her favorite techniques is to trap a target within her latex suit and excite them until they can now longer stand.
-Clement, "The Inquisitor" - The infamously smelly villainess, she's known as the gang's go-to if they wish to torture some poor fool. When The Lipstick Stars aren't dominating their prey in wrestling or milking them for all they're worth, she hits them with stench after stench. Some say they don't even always use her to extract information. They say that they just use her because they like seeing their victims squirm. In addition to her usual appearance, she boasts shiny green lipstick.
-Lydia, "The Executioner" - The infamous lady with the bottomless gut, she's the one the gang primarily uses to get rid of toys they're no loner interested in. In combat, she usually squeezes prey until they can't breath, or uses her poisonous gases to leave them vulnerable to the other Lipstick Stars' devices. Ultimately, she is the final destination for all of the Lipstick Stars' toys. In the end, she always devours the toys, whether they disobey them, or whether they're just sick of them, she's ready to devour anything that can fill up her gut.
-Celica, "The Leader" - And the villainess responsible for organizing the gang. She hasn't been talked about before, though that's because she's been saving her power for just the right moment. Celica is a black tiger dressed in what the Pint Puncher would describe as a shadow-y version of his own suit. She bears black fur and even blacker stripes, hips twice the length of the hero's shoulder span, 13 feet in height, giant breasts, and dark blue lipstick. She boasts the horrible power to suck someone's power out of their body and into her's with a mere kiss. She wishes to plant a kiss on the hero and suck his super strength and flight out before taking those powers for herself.
15533323333333233223322.title: Another villain please

choices: Paula makes the first move
Clement attacks first
Lydia struck first
155333233333332332233221.content:
Rowland flew back from the force of a powerful strike. He landed on his feet, skidding back, arms up in a guarding stance. He was in some abandoned warehouse. He had no idea how he got here, but all he knew was that some guy in the shadows was trying to beat him up. He emitted a flame to try and see the source of his attacker, and saw a surprising sight. He thought he saw the Pint Puncher's outfit, though it seemed much larger than normal. He also noticed that the suit was a lot blacker than usual, and he could tell that wasn't just the darkness.

"Who are you?" Rowland asked confused. He looked up at the attacker's face, and saw a feline head atop a torso sporting a massive rack. He got to know a lot of villains, but he never saw anyone like this.

"Call me your superior," the figure responded. "You may not realize it yet, but in just a few short moments, you'll be outdated." Rowland grit his teeth.

"Do you honestly think someone like me can be replaced?" Rowland shot back. Then, he began charging towards the figure. However, a snake-like figure in the dark smacked against his stomach, throwing him away from the mysterious figure. Rowland suddenly felt himself in the clutches of some rubbery substance. He felt his wrists pinned down to his sides, and he felt his legs lifted above the ground. He strained against the bindings while the lady in the evil Pint Puncher outfit approached. As she got closer, Rowland began to notice more and more about her.

She looked like a black tiger, boasting incredible hips and a bust, as well as lips painted with dark blue lipstick. "I'm Celica, and I'm about to rock this world." Suddenly, she kissed Rowland on the lips. She held her kiss for 3 seconds before pulling away. Rowland began feeling funny.

"What'd you do to me?" Rowland asked.

"I took your powers," Celica answered. "Every. Bit. Of it." Rowland's eyes shot open in fear. He struggled against the restraints of the rubber, but he felt himself losing his amazing body. His opposable thumbs faded, his limbs shrank back to normal form, and his muscles faded. Before long, Rowland was reduced to a normal tiger. Celica then snapped her fingers, producing a tiny flame. "Felicia's elastic body, Olivia's invisibility, and now Rowland's pyrokinesis. I think we're ready to take the city, girls."

---

The Pint Puncher heard reports of villains suddenly disappearing. Under normal circumstances, this'd be good news. But the missing villains were in the middle of mischief when they suddenly vanished. Felicia was reeking havoc downtown one moment, then disappeared. Olivia was groping unfortunate individuals while invisible one moment, and then she disappeared the next. Now Roland disappeared. And he was always late to these fights. The villains would disappear before he had the chance to get involved. He knew either they were planning something, or something far more dangerous is afoot.

He heard tells of a smelly villain using their power to manipulate wind to send their stench all over downtown. He knew he had to get to this villainess, fast. Or else risk having the one behind these attacks disappear before he could find out what they could possibly be planning. He flew to the source, and wound up on one roof. He saw a certain black-and-white skunk lady facing away from him. However, this skunk lady was now wearing green-spandex instead of her usual attire. When the villainess turned around, he also spied her lips painted green with lipstick.

"What's the meaning of this?" the Pint Puncher wondered out loud.

"Heh, looks like you fell for it hook-line and sinker!" Clement declared. She clapped her hands, and the Pint Puncher heard movement around him. Behind him, to his right, he saw Lydia, except she wore a purple bathing suit and purple lipstick. Behind him to his left, he saw Paula, except instead of her normal latex suit, she wore cherry red latex along with cherry red lipstick. Then, he heard a chuckling nearby. He scanned around, curious, when suddenly, a figure faded in from out of nowhere, as if they were just invisible.

"I've been waiting for this moment," the figure stated. The hero was confused. He never saw this villain before. She was a black tiger, wearing dark blue lipstick. But the most striking feature of her was her tight spandex, which looked like some sort of perversion of his own suit. It was like some evil version of his own suit. "Like the get up? You've been a big inspiration for me~"

"Who-who are you? And why are you wearing that?" the Pint Puncher asked.

"Oh this? This is just the suit of the heart of the city. Once I'm done with you, I'll make sure to brandish the memory of the fallen hero to the town all the time. Once someone sees me, they'll see the person that finished the Pint Puncher once and for all."

"I don't even know your name," the Pint Puncher argued.

"And that's because I wasn't ready to reveal it too soon. But I've done some training, and I think I can afford some exposure. First though, I need to beat you here." The black tiger went invisible again, and suddenly reappeared outside of the perimeter the three villainesses formed. "The name's Celica, by the way. And you're history!" With dramatic flare, the villainess snapped her fingers overhead, wordlessly ordering the other villainesses to attack.
155333233333332332233221.title: Lipstick Stars

choices: The ladies say she should continue
Paula claims control
Clement claims control
1553332333333323322332213.content:
At the snap, Lydia slithered towards the hero from behind. Before he could respond, Lydia curled her torso around his midsection, before standing upright. The way she moved always weirded the hero out. She had a knot around his midsection, yet he stood upright and towered over him. She could easily maneuver her upper and lower half at the same time while constricting him. He didn't have any more opportunity to consider, before she strained, crushing his abdomen. After a brief squeeze, Lydia tossed him away, leaving him stumbling onto the floor.

"You really should watch your back when the executioner is in town!" Lydia declared, tauntingly smacking her rear at him. She twisted her torso so her upper body was facing him, her rear still pointed at him. "I may not be able to kill you yet, but I can make you hurt a lot." Her lower half twisted around, her front facing him. "Course, I'm not the only one here that wants to toy with you. What do you ladies say? Do I still get to play with him?"
1553332333333323322332213.title: Lydia struck first

choices: Beg Paula to let him out
Clement showed up, ready to make things so bad for the hero
Layla showed up with a rumbly belly
Celica showed up for the Pint Puncher's powers
15533323333333233223322131.content:
"Eh, I want this boy to see what an executioner can do~" Paula said.

"Yeah, I want you to wring his neck a little bit~" Clement said. The Pint Puncher turned towards Lydia, who shrugged.

"You heard them," Lydia said. Then, suddenly, she flew forth, gliding through the air. She dove under the hero's arm and around his torso, putting her upper half in front of him and her lower half in front of him. She grabbed his wrists and held them up, keeping him trapped. And then, she squeezed. Just to make things worse, she coiled around the hero's neck, and squeezed as well.

"Say hello to the gallows hold!" Lydia shouted, constricting him. The hero's air supply was suddenly cut off. He couldn't breath! His ribs were being crushed under the eel's coils, and he couldn't breath! He couldn't believe he was letting himself get beaten like this. As if things couldn't get worst, Lydia's rump came into view. She planted one foot on one of her coils, then the other, then Lydia helped hold her rump up. "You remember what I can do, right?"

"NOOOOOO!" the hero howled as the butt covered his face. Then, just as quickly as he was enveloped, Lydia unleashed a bubbly fart onto him. Lydia's stench smelled like rotten fish! He probably would've been more grossed out if Lydia's special power didn't take hold. In addition to her constrictable body, Lydia's gasses were known to infect those who smell it with hypnosis. He already felt it take control. He was getting lulled into a dream-like state.

"Good~" Lydia said. "Now... sleep~" At that, against the hero's will, he felt his eyelids begin to shut. Part of him said he needed to stop them. Part of him was screaming that he needed to stay awake, or else they'll do whatever they can to him! And yet... sleep was inescapable. He was enveloped in darkness, and found himself in a slumber.

...

The hero finally woke up, and got up. He rubbed his forehead instinctually, but realized something. There was no mask on his face! He looked down at himself, and realized he was stripped down to his underwear!

"How did-?" the hero asked. But then, the last thing he remembered came into mind. Those four ladies! He remembered Lydia squeezed him, and now he was stuck in some random spot, half naked. He looked around his waking area, and got a good read on his situation. Three of the walls were sheer steel, the floor and ceiling were steel as well, and the only other wall was without a wall. However, it wasn't quite open. No, instead there was a wall of red rubber stretched over the gap, a few prison-like bars formed from it. He was in a makeshift jail cell!

The hero peered through the gaps in the rubber. They were all thinner than one of his fingers, and, after pushing them, he found he couldn't budge them. He was trapped! Through the gap, he could see Paula, sitting down and looking at the cell. Of course, her rubber suit molded off of her body and over the gap, forming an inescapable wall. By now, Paula was just wearing a thong and a thin bra over her breasts. She tauntingly smacked her lips at the hero, who shivered at the notion.

"L-let me go!" the hero demanded, pounding against the rubber bars.

"Sorry, boy," Paula said. "I've been given explicit orders to make sure you stay where you are. Now sit back down, and wait for one of the Lipstick Stars to treat you~" At that, Paula turned around and leaned on the wall adjacent to the rubber wall she set up. Lipstick Stars? Was that what those four called themselves? If he was in their custody, he needed to find a way out of here!
15533323333333233223322131.title: The ladies say she should continue

choices: Kim
More Villains
155333233333332332233222.content:
Kim - One of the few villains to have met Pint Puncher prior to her transformation. Originally, she was a small Bombay cat living in a shoddy old animal shelter. It was there that she subjected to a great deal of neglect. The owner, while ultimately well meaning, was very inept when it came to animal care and often took in more than he could accommodate. It was do to his mismanagement that a fire broke out in the store and his life was taken along with most of the animals. Kim managed to escaped by the skin of her death, though she came out of the incident with singed fur and the tip of her ear clipped slightly.

Her life outside of the shelter proved to be just as miserable, as she spent most of her time scrounging for food and looking for a place to sleep. No one would give her the time of day and quite often, she would be subjected to abuse by rowdy school children or bitter homeless people. Such experiences instilled in him a deep seated distrust of humans. That changed ever so slightly when she met Pint Puncher.

There was nothing remarkable about him at the time. He was simply a bright eyed young man with a desire to do good. All he did was pet her on the head and give her a few bits of beef jerky he had been carrying, but in Kim's eyes it was the kindness thing that anyone could ever do for her. Ever since that day she made a note to follow him around at a distance, often watching him from the shadows. This behavior would continue on even after her transformation, though she's much more inclined to interact with Pint Puncher in her new form.

Standing nearly ten feet tall, Kim cuts quite the imposing figure. She has large perky breast, a round supple bottom and thick muscular thighs. For the most part, her body is obscured by her jet black fur, though she's able to materialize clothing using her ability to control shadows. She possesses cold, soulless eyes that seem to only come to life whenever she's around Pint Puncher.

Aside from the immense strength and speed brought on by her towering body, Kim has the ability to control shadows. At a moment's notice she can completely meld into the darkness, shapeshift, or paralyze people by seizing their own shadow. Once someone truly angers her, she can capture their "essence" by stealing their shadow, thus robbing them of their powers.

Kim has a very simple way of thinking: No one matters but Pint Puncher. She has an unyielding hatred for all living things, regardless of what species of creature they are, yet she deeply loves Puncher and wants nothing more than to spend time with him. She violently protective of him, to the point where brutally torture anyone that attempts to do him harm in her presence. Whenever she's with him, she becomes jovial and playful, doing everything she can to show him how much she cares for him. Unfortunately, this often is to Pint Puncher's detriment, as her idea of showing affection tends to involve her roughhousing him in some way. Spending so much of her life alone left her emotionally and mentally stunted and as a result, she doesn't know how she's supposed to treat those she cares about. This is reflected by her speech patterns, as she tends to speak in a very broken dialect, even referring to herself in the third person.

Kim really doesn't have an end goal. She just wants to be with Puncher, though she's not all that hesitant to cause wanton violence and destruction in order to get to him.
155333233333332332233222.title: Kim

choices: He tries to talk to Kim. She saved him, so maybe she's not so bad...
He tries to escape Kim. She's clearly dangerous!
1553332333333323322332221.content:
It wasn't a very good day for Pint Puncher. What started as a simple patrol of the city streets soon became a fight for his life, as he was suddenly ambushed by two of his most dangerous foes. He had been flying through the city when he was suddenly knocked out of the sky by a large boulder that had been lobbed directly at him. Before he could recover from the surprise attack, he found himself pinned against the sweaty sole of Quaker. As he struggled to fend off her enormous foot, he could see Boris standing to the side with a wide grin on his face.

"How's it going, little man?" Quaker taunted as she pressed her foot down on him, squeezing the air from his lungs. "I didn't mean to surprise you like I did, but I had to get your attention somehow. The funny thing is, I wasn't even trying to hit you!"

"We wanted to work up a sweat fighting you, but I guess we'll have to get right to the meat of things" Boris chimed in with a chuckle. "Quaker, I'm a little tuckered out from breaking you out of the penitentiary. Would you mind tenderizing him for me? Feel free to add your own unique spices to the mix"

"You don't need to tell me twice!" She snickered before lifting her foot off of Puncher and holding it up high in the air.

"N-No... please... don't...!" he pleaded as he held his hands up in a futile effort to protect himself. His words fell on death ears as her foot came plummeting down onto his much smaller body, the resulting impact causing the earth to cave in beneath him. His mind was rattled by the immense pain, though he wasn't given much time to linger on it before Quaker lifted her foot again and stomped it back down with even greater force. Over and over again, Quaker stomped down on Pint Puncher with all the force her heavy frame could manage. The brutal assault was percilessly short, though she kept her foot on top of him and twisted it as though he were a bug. It would take him days to wash out the smell of mud and sweat from his costume, though Boris would ensure that he'd never have to worry about such a thing ever again.

Quaker lifted her foot to admire her handiwork, though was surprised to see him missing. At first she thought that he had managed to give them the slip before the sound of pained groans caught her attention and she glanced at the bottom of her foot to find Pint Puncher plastered to it.

"Aww, look Boris! I think he likes playing with my feet!" She chortled as she held her foot up higher to allow him a better look at the broken hero.

"As much as I hate to cut into your fun hero, I haven't eaten all day!" Boris bellowed slapping his enormous gut. After peeling his beaten body from off Quaker's foot, he held him up to his nose and gave him a few sniffs. "Hm! Quite the exotic flair you put on this, Quaker! You and I need to hang out more. I could use some of that African spice on more of my food!"

"Oh you~" Quaker giggled.

"Don't... don't do this... please..." Pint Puncher mumbled, his energy all but sapped from his brutal beating.

"I'd be more willing talk things out with you, but I can't think on an empty stomach!" Boris snickered before dangling Pint Puncher over his gaping maw. All seemed lost as Pint Puncher closed his eyes and prepared himself for the end.

He waited.

And waited.

And waited.

Opening his eyes, he could see that his situation hadn't changed. He was still hanging percariously over Boris' massive mouth, but something seemed amiss. Any pretense of playful sadism was gone from Boris' face as he trembled as though he were struggling to move.

"Hurry up and eat him, Boris! We've got a city to take over!" Quaker ordered impatiently

"A-Ah... Aah chaan!" he cried, attempting to speak with his mouth still opened wide.

"What do you mean you can't?!"

"Ah chaan whoo~!"

"You... can't move?" Quaker repeated curiously.

Scum.

Quaker blinked and looked around as a voice echoed around them.

"Who's there! Show yourself!" she demanded.

Scum., the voice repeated.

Suddenly, Quaker began to feel a sinking sensation, as though she were standing in a thick puddle of mud. Looking down, her eyes widened at the sight of a pitch black, gooey substance pulling her down into the earth. She gasped and attempted to pull herself free, but couldn't so much as budge as she was slowly consumed by the black ooze. Boris didn't know what to make of the sight, but soon found himself in the same situation as he began to sink into the ground as well.

"W-what's h-happening to us!?" Quaker cried as she pound her mighty fists against the earth in the hopes of freeing herself. Whatever the substance was, brute force proved useless against it as it her hands were ensnared as well. Her attention was soon shifted forward as a tall, imposing figure slowly rose from the ground several feet away from her and Boris. A black pillar stood in front of them before a set of cold, piercing yellow eyes formed near the top. The pillar quickly took shape, molding into a voluptuous cat woman who stood with her hand outstretched.

"You. You hurt him. You are scum" she spat bitterly before turning her attention to Pint Puncher who hung limp in Boris' hand. Her cold eyes softened upon seeing him, her body language becoming significantly less hostile. With a wave of her hand, Pint Puncher was lifted out of Boris' hand by the same black substance that ensnared the two villains. With another gesture, she brought Pint Puncher over to her and sat him down onto the ground gently.

"T-thank you--"

He was cut off as the strange cat woman hosted his body up and embraced him in a crushing hug, his head almost disappearing into her cleavage.

"Mmm... safe~" she cooed happily as she shook him back and forth. Her gaze soon shifted to the other two, who remained frozen by the black ooze. Her eyes immediately became cold and lifeless again as she sat Puncher down and turned to face them. Boris and Quaker were completely dumbfounded by the sudden turn of events, as neither of them had ever been such a compromising position before. After staring at them wordlessly for a solid minute, the stranger pointed at them and uttered a single word that sent chills down their spines.

"Die"

With that, the ooze began pulling them both down with renewed vigor. Quaker thrashed and screamed in desperation while Boris remained frozen and unable offer the slightest bit of resistance. Pint Puncher watched the sight in a mixture of confusion and horror. He had fought the two of them many times before not once had he ever seen them show the slightest bit of fear. Up until that point, he had been the most challenging opponent they had ever faced and even then, he often fought them on an even keel. They had never been put in such a situation before, where they were completely helpless and powerless before a deadly foe that sought their demise.

They had done so much harm, not just to him but to Glam City as a whole, but the sight of them panicking and fighting for their lives left Pint Puncher feeling uneasy. He couldn't let them die like that, especially in such a slow, gruesome manner. He turned to the tall cat woman and grabbed onto her leg, looking at her with fearful eyes.

"Please! Spare them! They don't deserve this!" He pleaded. His intervention came as a surprise to the stranger as she knelt down to meet his gaze, her eyes becoming soft once more.

"They are bad. They hurt you. Kim make them go away forever. Then they can't hurt you anymore... " she explained calmly as she placed a hand on his back. Despite her initial display of strength, her hand was soft and warm, gently massaging his back in an attempt to comfort him.

"Kim... Don't do this. Let them go... please...!" he cried before looking back at the two villains. They were almost completely gone as the ooze reached up to their necks. It was only a matter of time before it reached their mouths and then...

"PLEASE!" Pint Puncher begged as he fell to his knees in front of her. The strange cat woman now identified as Kim tilted her head with a frown before looking over to the doomed pair. She snapped her fingers and instantly they stopped sinking. Quaker looked down at the ground and saw that the ooze was gone. Before where it felt like she was sinking into a thick fluid, she now could feel that her body was submerged in the ground. Letting out a shaky sigh of relief she looked over at Pint Puncher with a look that caught him completely off guard; it was an look of genuine, earnest gratitude.

"T-thank you... s-so much, Pint Puncher..." she muttered.

Pint Puncher simply nodded before looking back over to Kim, who seemed completely disinterested in the pair now that she had released them. She stared at him with a bright, happy smile as she fiddled with her tail like a shy schoolgirl. Somehow, her giddy demeanor unnerved him the most.

"Puncher... Punchy... Punchy~" she tittered as her face reddened.

"Um... yeah... I guess you can call me that" he said as he took a step back.

"Kim" she said pointing to herself.

"I know. You told me that already" Puncher stated as the tried to think of a way to depart from the bizarre amazon that stood before him. Without warning he was suddenly scooped off the ground into yet another crushing embrace, his head having to bear the weight of her enormous boobs as he was pulled into her stomach.

"Kim loves Punchy...~" she mewled as she ragdolled him about.

The disoriented hero thought of his next move...

Despite coming out in a cold, hushed whisper, Kim's words cut through the air like a knife. Her very presence seemed to cause a certain tension in the air, as though they were in a room with with a dangerous beast rather than a statuesque feline. They exited the store swiftly, yet moved with caution as to not potentially put her on edge any further. While Pint Puncher felt somewhat slighted by their lack of assistance, he was relieved to see them spared of Kim's wrathful hand. She didn't seem to notice or care about the obvious discomfort that she was causing him as she sniffed the top of his head, her fact contorting in disgust and anger.

"Stinky" she said irritably.

As first Puncher wasn't sure what she was talking about but he quickly recalled the events that led up to their meeting. Not ten minutes ago he was being peeled off of the bottom of Quaker's foot, his body reeking of dirt and sweat. He made it a point to thoroughly bathe after dealing with the numerous evildoers in the city, as he didn't want any of his fans to catch him smelling like another person's bodily fluids. Having it brought to his attention made his face redden in embarrassment.

"Y-yeah. Sorry about that, I--"

His words were cut short as Kim pushed her chest forward, completely burying his head in her furry cleavage. He let out a muffled as he struggled to pull away, his super strength doing him little good against Kim's bulky frame. This went on for a solid minute before she pulled back, leaving the soaked in sweat and gasping for air. She looked down at him with a proud smile before leaning down to take in his scent again.

"No more stinky! Now you mine!" she giggled. It was that statement that made her intentions clear to Puncher. She wasn't bothered by the rank stench coming from his body; she just didn't like the fact that it wasn't her stench that radiated off of him.

"Play some more, yes?" she asked as her tail wagged frantically.

"No! No more playing. I want you to tell me who you are and why you're following me!" Pint Puncher demanded as he attempted to wipe the sweat from his face. His confrontational tone didn't seem to register to Kim as she stood in front of him with an innocent smile.

"Kim is Kim. Kim follow Punchy because Kim loves Punchy!" she explained before reaching forward to give him yet another hug. Pint Puncher grabbed onto her arms and pushed them back, his expression remaining stern.

"We've established that already, but why exactly do you love me? I've never seen you before in my life!"

Kim blinked and cocked her head to the side in confusion. It never occurred to her that her love wouldn't recognize her in her current state. The last time they had saw each other was prior to the event that caused them to gain their respective powers. Back then she was nothing more than a filthy alley cat scrounging for food. Come to think of it, she didn't recall ever seeing him wearing that silly outfit of prior to the event. She was certain that he was the young man who so selflessly fed her when all others had ignored her. His disguise was useless against her acute sense of smell.

"You give food when Kim was small" she explained as she made gestures with her hands to illustrate how small she used to be.

Pint Puncher raised a brow at her claim. It was safe to assume that she was once a normal cat, but that fact didn't exactly narrow it down. After thinking it over for a minute, the memory came back to him. He had been walking home from the store when he spotted a small black cat digging through the trash. A wild animal scourging for scraps certainly wasn't a new occurrence, but the haggered fur and clipped ear had given him pause. He had felt sorry for the poor thing and gave it a few pieces of jerky before going on his way. He didn't think much of it after the fact, but his small act of kindness had created an intense obsession within the feline.

Kim had shadowed him ever since that moment, watching the hero-to-be just out of his line of sight. The only thing that kept her from interacting with him directly was her previous experiences deal with humans, who would all turn their noses at her due to her disheveled appearance. Just when it seemed as though she’d never get to be with him, an incident occured that caused her to transform into a towering and curvaceous anthro along with granting her numerous otherworldly abilities. With her beautiful new body, she was confident that the hero love would embrace her with loving arms.

Kim giggled and struck a pose, her massive breasts jutting out as she placed a hand on her wide hip. The hero had to admit, she was certainly easy on the eyes, but that fact alone wasn’t enough to dissuade his distrust of her. She might have been attractive, but she was still unstable and quite dangerous. Plus, she knew his secret identity, having singled him out despite him wearing a mask.

"Alright, Kim? I'm gonna need you to wait right here while I go take care of something important" he said slowly. He still had to contact the authorities to come and get Quaker and Boris.

Kim's face soured for a moment, her eyes burning with disdain. She knew exactly what he intended to do and it angered her to think that he would waste his time aiding the two that only sought to harm him. They were in her way. “That fat swine and elephant.” Kim seethed. As long as they continued to exist, she would not have her beloved Punchy’s undivided attention. She needed to get rid of them. “But what about Punchy?” Wondered the dark feline. Kim’s ears lowered against her skull and she slumped forward as she looked to the floor. For some reason he did not want her to kill the fat pair, even though they were his enemies and tried to end his own life. If it were up to Kim, she would have snuffed the two out right then and there. She just wanted to keep him safe, but she did not want to upset her little love. Kim racked herself on the head with her fists and shook her head just at the thought of displeasing her sweetheart. If she killed them the he would certainly be angry with her and she could not bear that. No. There had to be another way. Kim’s pointed ears suddenly perked up and she stood up straight as her gloomy eyes lit up while her lips twisted into a devious smile. “Yes. That would work” She thought. She knew how to get rid of her elephant and boar problem without technically killing them. In fact, the two may prove useful to Kim. The pantherine feline watched her Pint Puncher fly off into the night sky before she sank into the shadows of the empty shop. She swiftly moved across the floor and up a wall before slipping through the large hole she and Puncher had made in the ceiling, disappearing into the city streets.

Quaker had been trying to free herself for a good while now but did not seem to be making progress. Her powers had abandoned her. She was stuck from the neck down and could not do anything to free herself. “Hey! Boris! You still with me?” The elephant called out to her fellow ne’er-do-well. She could not turn to face him but she knew he was there. She could smell him. He did not answer, seeming to have lost consciousness from the previous ordeal. “Dammit!” Quaker cursed. She slumped her head and uttered a defeated sigh. “I’d never have thought I’d need that pain in the ass to show up and save me. Where is that good for nothing pintsized Puncher when you actually need him anyway?” Quaker said to no one in particular.

A shadow slid down a nearby rooftop and into the dark alley. Quaker almost missed it while she was lost in her thoughts. “W-what was that?” She asked herself.

Quaker stared into the shadows before her. Nothing seemed to be out of the ordinary. Her large fan-like ears did not detect any movement besides a few non anthropomorphized rats scurrying in the dark. The only noise she heard was the bustle of the city at large. Something moved in front of her earning a started yelp from the once formidable pachyderm. Quaker hated feeling like this. Helpless, vulnerable, weak! She was jumping at shadows. “Calm down, Quaker,” she thought, “you’ll be out of here in no time. That fool hero is probably on his way right now. He gets me out. I’ll probably do some time in some holding facility but I’ll bust out and be back to theorizing the city and sitting on Puncher in no time.” She assured herself.

“Kim won't let fat elephant hurt Puncher!” Said an unseen voice.

Quaker nearly jumped out of her skin. “Who said that?!” She asked in a panicked voice. “who’s there?” After a second, she saw them. Two piercing, baleful eyes in the dark. “Wait! t-those eyes!” Quaker uttered in a shaky voice. The color drained from her face.

“Ugly fat elephant lady won’t do anything ever again.” Kim hissed. She moved towards Quaker and Boris’ motionless body, slithering along the floor as a black trail of living shadow.

“You again?! Stay back!” Quaker shrieked. Kim steadily drew closer.

“N-no! Stay back you damn cat!” Quaker demanded.

Kim advanced, those intense eyes fixed on her target. Until she was close enough. Kim lunged forth at a horrified Quaker.

Pint Puncher heard a bloodcurdling scream from somewhere below. He stopped in mid-flight. “That sounded like Quaker.” He stated. He was on his way to claim the elephant and her boar partner in crime for the authorities. “What’s going on?” He wondered. He resumed his flight, picking up the pace as it were, until he reached the alley where he left them. He descended to the floor and was puzzled to not see anything. Anyone. Then he saw it. A black pool of inky shadow in the darkness of the barely illuminated alley, where Boris and Quaker should have been.

“H-how did she get here before me?” Puncher pondered, immediately recognizing what he saw. “Stop Kim!”

The still pool of shadow seemed to react to the sound of his voice. It began to swirl and bubble before it took the shape of a familiar humanoid-pantherine female. “Punchy!” Kim cred with glee. She ran at the object of her obsession with her out stretched arms intent on scooping him up into another hug.

“Don’t touch me!” Barked the Pint Puncher. This caused the tall black cat to stop in her tracks. Her giddy smile fading a little bit. Was he angry with her?

He was aware of what felt like softness under his bare bottom, so he was quickly aware that he was still naked. He grumbled in annoyance and soon got to get an idea of where he was. He found himself upon a bed with sky-blue sheets, it seeming cartoonish-ly oversized.

The room itself was fairly blue, featuring wardrobes, a makeup stand with a mirror and all sorts of lipstick, and a bunch of posters of various villains. He'd also notice in the corner of the room was none other than Carol the gator, who exuded an aura to disable super powers. The Pint Puncher glowered at her, before trying to fly. Sure enough, he was stuck here. If Sabrina were to show up here, her physicality would certainly overwhelm him.

For now, though, he'd have to hope that he could figure some way out of this room...

A government funded laboratory researching various animal species in the hope of finding possible beneficial gene modifications in humans was the site of a disaster. One the night the phenomenon that created the intelligent, anthropomorphic creatures that plague the world. There was a mysterious explosion that tore the facility apart. Many dangerous wildlife specimens were loosed on the unsuspecting populace, many of which would undergo the changes. Three in particular would find each other in the swamps outside the hero’s city. They would come to be known as the Sisterhood of Scales. The Pint Puncher has not had many encounters with the three. Which is probably a good thing.

Physical Appearance: Full figured. Physically strong. large breasts, thick thighs, wide hips, and rotund buttocks. Long powerful legs and thick, heavy tail as long as her body. Wears a white tank top with the bottom torn away to expose her midriff, also wears denim short-shorts.



Abilities: Superhuman strength, armored skin resistant to everything short of armor piercing weapons...or a bomb. Enhanced endurance and stamina. Adept swimmer. Strong sense of smell and a devastating bite.

When the strange event occurred, Abby underwent drastic mutations that transformed her into a veritable giantess. Standing well over the heads of her fellow fem fa-tales, Abby is the battering ram of the group. If the Sisterhood needs a wall busted down, or a city block leveled, this she-hulk’s their girl. In a fight Abby is a walking tank. Police standard issue firearms may as well be spitball shooters as far as she is concerned. Abby could wreck a city block on her own. If there is a saving grace it's that the crocodilian is not that bright. She was not blessed with the same intellect as her sisters, it's possible all that extra brain power went to her marvelous body instead. Abigail is also the most playful and childish of the group. Many a policeman has found themselves under the gator’s prodigious backside, struggling for breath as their heads are swallowed up by the cleft. They are usually found later, unconscious, and laying in an ass shaped crater. It's a demoralizing sight to this brickhouse of scales and teeth barreling down a city street but at least she doesn't bite...too much.

Dislikes: Responsibility, mean people, remarks concerning her weight.

Can sense heat signatures. Can swallow large objects.

The snake is the trio’s spy and infiltration specialist. She’s selfish and ruthless, as she's sadistic, relishing inflicting pain on her enemies. If that were not enough, Viper is also extremely hot-tempered, as she can easily lose her temper at the faintest slight or blow received. The serpent is also sexually provocative; has a devious sense of humor and a foul mouth, often taunting her opponents before the fighting starts. Viper prefers to fight up close. She quickly closes the distance before laying the smack down on her target. This includes beating her opponent down in a viscous display of taekwondo. If the object of her ire is lucky though, Viper will simply paralyze them with her venomous bite. Rendering them helpless. Then she coils her tail or limber body around them and a good slow squeeze is all it takes to seal the deal.

As the leader of Viper and Abbie, Kim is calm and collected. All ways thinking. Calculating. There is a dark side to the lizard. Something that keeps even the wily Viper in line. The lizard believes she is destined to rule and her goal is to bring all the world underneath her heel as it’s one true “Dragon Queen”, starting with Glam City. However, a certain nuisance, a self-proclaimed hero in white has been standing in her way. This will not stand!

15533323333333233223322222424323.content:
Lorîta:

A young female Golden Jackal that once lived in the vast plains of central Africa before being abducted from her family by a group of poachers and sold off to a representative of an hidden underground organization who smuggled her out of the country. The people of the underground organization treated her and other abducted animals to cruel experiments with the intention of creating a drug that would alter cells to force and intensify evolutionary traits of various animals into other life forms to create super powered beings that they planned to use to force their rule over earth. Lorîta was eventually found to be the only creature able to survive the experiments and was made the sole guinea pig for the organization to further test on. A year after her capture, results began to show as the jackal's physique became anthropomorphic and gained an average human level of intellect. Her fur was golden yellow with two beige stripes that went down her back to her waist. The jackal stood four feet tall with a well toned, yet curvaceous body. She had relatively small breasts, but great beefy thighs. She also found that she had now possessed super strength and the gift of shape-shifting. After another year in captivity, she now stood at an even eight feet tall and had mastered her new abilities and used them to destroy the underground organization along with all the humans inside of it leaving only a crater behind. Lorîta's long experience in captivity had left a mental scar in her mind. Living most of her life in cages and operating tables in a heartless environment gave her a misanthropic view on life. Seeing all humans as evil and selfish creatures that she needed to rid the world of by using the powers they gave her as a weapon against them. She wandered the lands for a few months, laying waste to some small towns and villages in her path, before making herself home in a large cave in some foothills where she lived in relative solitude. Unbeknownst to Lorîta, she was residing in the outskirts of Glam City which was home to a certain boy wonder. Lorîta was shocked when one day she had come across another super powered creature, a t-rex by the name of Taurus who's life was parallel to her own, even having a mutual hatred towards humans. A close bond quickly grew between the two and Lorîta was introduced to a number of other super powered animals such as Helen, Quaker, Sabrina, Tallio and more. While the jackal was not fond of most of these other villains, perceiving them as big of a burden as humans were and even getting into scuffles with them, she did find their forms to be useful for her shape-shift into. Lorîta refined their forms in the hills with occasional sparring with some of the more tolerable villains and even learned to shape-shift into any villain almost instantaneously. She even discovered that she could even mimic others unique abilities when shifting into them, but was unable to access their full strength. Lorîta also found that shape-shifting took a toll on her. Prolonged use of her ability gradually drained her stamina and the bigger the form was, the faster her stamina was drained. Lorîta is able to endure most hits, but still remains weaker than the almighty Pint Puncher. She had heard from the villains that there was a superhuman by the name of The Pint Puncher in a nearby city who made an oath to protect humanity. This angered Lorîta, who vowed to one day beat down this Pint Puncher and destroy Glam City.


The Great Gadali


From origins unknown, The Great Gadali is a five foot tall curvy fennec fox skilled in the arts of witchcraft. She is a millennia old witch dressed in a black off shoulder gown with a very spoiled personality. Gadali is seen more often than not traveling with her two giant feral pet grey wolves. A female wolf known as Lela and a male wolf referred to as Deacon are centuries old wolves tamed by Gadali and given magical enhancements to keep their bodies from aging as well as improve their size, strength and senses. The wolves both stand at seven feet on all fours and obey any command given to them by Gadali without hesitation. Gadali routinely torments the citizens by siccing on them her two subjects to trample, eat, smother, insert and stink up while she relishes in their suffering. Occasionally she will order her pets to bring back an unwilling human to indulge her in sexual acts. If the brawn of her wolves is not enough to take down her opponents, Gadali is able to place an alteration spell on them to transform them into twelve foot tall bipedal behemoths capable of toppling over skyscrapers in one swing. Lela and Deacon normally fight together, using their numerical advantage and overwhelming strength to bring down whoever dared to oppose their master. Gadali herself is no stronger than the average human and hugely depends on her wolves to pick up her slack. If forced to fight, the fennec can utilize a few spells such as teleportation, creating afterimages, size manipulation and temporary immobilization.

It was Thanksgiving in the town, and there was a big parade downtown. Lots of people were having turkey while watching the parade go by. It seemed like a strange for a live turkey to wander about, but no-one seemed to mind as one ran towards a crowd, gobbling up a storm. In fact, a few kids seemed to laugh at it. The turkey spied all of the turkey being served at the restaurant, and when she was right in the middle of a crowd, she decided it was time to feast.

The turkey started to shine gold, much to the surprise of the crowd. The parade even stopped as she shined. The light expanded, taking the vague shape of a 16 foot bbw. The light dispersed, and the crowd collectively gasped as they saw the infamous Debra. Before anyone could even scream and try to run, the large turkey squatted, and let loose a loud fart, a horrid, broccoli fueled stench wafting throughout the street. The crowd couldn't get away in time, and they all fell unconscious. Meanwhile, the fiendish Debra stood high and mighty, laughing a mighty laugh.

info.brief_description: The Pint Puncher works to save the day from dangerous animals. But can he save himself?
info.description:
The main character is a young, human male that one day got the power of super strength and flight. Being able to live out his superhero fantasies, he adorns a white full body spandex and white wrestler mask and blue cape, and saves the day as the Pint Puncher. Unfortunately, it seems that the phenomenon that gave him his powers also gave animals super powers. Worse still, they seem like they want to use them for evil. They all earned the ability to walk upright and talk and understand human language, but they each have a super power specific to them. Now, in addition to the normal criminals, the Pint Puncher has to worry about great big monsters that want to eat him, squish him, stink him, or otherwise humiliate him.

Encouraged practices:

-Vore

-Stench play

-Squishing

-Undressing

-Tongue play

-Size play

-Domination

Rules:

1. Don't write in blood or gore. You can allude to a character meeting their end, but don't actually write about them wasting away in some creature's stomach or reduced to a stain underneath a creature. Also, don't write about broken limbs or bones.

2. The villains can only be super powered animals.

3. Make sure stories don't end to abruptly. For example, there is a character called Borris who's able to inhale many things and seeks to swallow the Pint Puncher. If you write that he manages to inhale the hero, don't have him swallow him outright. Extend the torment.

4. During character selection, make sure there's always an option for someone to add in another set of villains.

5. Villains can be male or female, large or Pint Puncher sized. But they must always be able to walk upright and be able to speak and understand human speech.

6. Villains can team up. If you so chose, you can have villains team up with villains from a set of villains later in the villain selection. For example, if you so choose, in the Hank chapter route, you can have Muro come in for an assist.
-That being said, I won't allow repeat team ups. For example, if in the Hank route you have Muro come in for an assist, in the Muro route, you can't have Hank come in for an assist

7. Villains may not even be real or living animals. If you wish, bring in dragons or dinosaurs, etc. Just make sure they aren't human or part human, so no minotaurs or centuars, etc.

8. The Pint Puncher can't perform sexual moves. He just sticks to strategic planning, flying, and hitting hard.

9. Unless under mind control, the Pint Puncher isn't willing in any of their acts

NEW: Two new events have begun! If you want to see the Pint Puncher fend off villains without his powers, the Handicap Match is there for you! If you want to see the Pint Puncher fight four villains at once, witness the Fearsome Four!

Villains
*Borris - a gigantic boar with a monster sized craving. He's able to suck anything not nailed down into his gullet before eating them. He typically likes to squash opponents, stick them up against his dick, and fart on them.
*Helen - a large hippo that likes to rob banks. She can adjust the strength and stench of her gasses (belches and farts), and uses this to over power targets. Sometimes she likes to eat opponents.
*Felicia - a vixen with the ability to stretch her body however she wishes. She typically smothers opponents with enlarged body parts. stuffs them down her throat or up her butt, and squash and fart on opponents.
*Hank - a honey badger known for his hypnotic BO. It stinks, but anyone that smells it instantly submits themselves to his will.
*Rowland - a cougar that can control fire and is able to grow big enough to restrain whoever he targets. It's his goal to reduce opponents to butt toys or sweat rags, and he'll go anything, from belching on them to farting on them to smothering them in his apartment, to achieve his goal.
*Muro - an arctic fox that's able to psychologically speak to opponents to make them do as he wishes. He likes to belch and/or fart on people before sending them up his butt.
*Charles - a German Shepherd that can use his saliva in order to hypnotize victims into acting like his pups. He usually smothers opponents with his BO to make them convert faster, and when they convert, he typically punishes them by making them taste his sweat or sending them up his butt.
*Mundo - a lizard that spits blinding fluids in order to make them more capable of being eaten.
*Melinda - a bunny with the power to multiply herself. She likes to smother opponents with they're feet and land butt first on them.
*Quaker - a massive elephant able to control earth. She uses this power to make targets more easy to step and sit on.
*Rhanier - a notoriously smelly hyena that's able to leap large distances. He likes forcing opponents up his butt.
*Shenny - a wolfess able to grow and smash up cars. She likes sticking enemies in her pussy.
